Job description – IT Data Science Intern

Summary

Ascend is seeking motivated students to join the IT Data Science team working from our Houston headquarters location. Interns will work with the data science team members and subject matter experts (SMEs) in the business to implement solutions to operate assets and processes more safely and efficiently. This is a hands-on internship. Interns will have the opportunity to apply functional skills and safety principles in a manufacturing environment while working on projects under the guidance and assistance of experienced team members. These projects may include process improvement, identifying and troubleshooting issues and developing the business’ big data platform. Through these hands-on experiences, interns will further develop their skill set and build relationships with data science and IT professionals.

To be eligible, candidates must be enrolled in an accredited college or university and preferably with 36 semester hours in a Computer Science, Statistics, Math or related STEM discipline or demonstrate equivalent experience. They must be in good academic standing and have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher.

This position requires strong interpersonal skills and drive for customer satisfaction. The successful candidate must be able to follow direction, ask for clarification, demonstrate business aptitude, solid analytical and problem-solving skills. They must have good written and verbal communication skills and be able to learn and adapt with new technologies.

Successful completion of the internship program will follow with a presentation to the team and fellow interns. The presentation will include an overview of what the intern learned from the program, the projects worked, and the intern’s overall experience.

Key Responsibilities

Perform data science projects targeted at process improvement within operations; i.e., increase efficiency, reliability (up-time) and stable operations.
Help translate SME requirements into practical solutions to problems or challenges in manufacturing assets or processes
Perform validation and testing to ensure solutions meet customer needs
Maintain models & data to ensure continued performance and to improve performance over time
Provide technical and administrative support for systems and related applications and services
Perform other duties as assigned by supervisor
Communicate technical concepts at a level appropriate for the audience
Students in this role must be local to Houston and have reliable transportation daily to get to and from our downtown headquarters location (1010 Travis St).

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Experience applying big data tools in Python, R, Matlab or similar coding environments
Exposure to deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch or Tensorflow.
Experience and demonstrated technical skills in machine learning: regression medeling and forecasting.
Experience working in big data platforms, such as, Microsoft Azure a plus.
Ability to translate real-world manufacturing & process challenges into data & model solutions that address customer needs
Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft desktop applications and various analytical products; such as, Excel, PowerBI or similar products
Understanding of fundamental big data concepts, processes and tools.

Employees in this position must possess mobility to work in a standard office setting and to use standard office equipment, including a computer; stamina to sit or stand and maintain attention to detail despite interruptions; may occasionally lift/carry/push/pull up to 25 pounds; may require occasional walking, climbing, stooping, crouching, and/or bending; and vision to read printed materials and a computer screen, and hearing and speech to communicate in person and over the telephone. May require the ability to travel by air or auto. May require the use of personal protective equipment such as safety glasses, safety shoes, and shop coat.

Skills Summary:
About Us:
Ascend Performance Materials is the premium provider of high quality chemicals, fibers and plastics. With world scale integrated manufacturing facilities we are able to develop new products from our core technologies, and provide flexibility to respond to the expanding needs of customers. Ascend has global sales and distribution facilities across the globe and six manufacturing facilities globally. As a privately-held company, our people do big things and make big decisions, often much earlier in their careers than at larger companies. Ascend Performance Materials offers team members the opportunity to contribute in big, meaningful ways—all within a stable and growing business.

Why work at Ascend?

Our vision is to be the recognized leader in the nylon 6,6 value chain, creating new possibilities with PA66 for everyone, everywhere, every day. We achieve that through living our Ascend values.

We care . We operate safely with high integrity for our employees, our customers and our communities. Our people are our greatest assets, and our Total Rewards Program extends beyond traditional benefits to include access to on-site medical clinics at our U.S. facilities, a global wellness rewards program and Performance Matters, an employee-driven recognition plan. Our Commitment to Zero demonstrates our belief that is it possible to operate with zero personal injuries, zero process safety incidents and zero environmental releases. And the Ascend Cares Foundation, led by Ascend employees, supports Ascend families in times of need, provides inspiring opportunities for community engagement and facilitates community leadership.

Customer-focused . We exist for our customers; they drive our actions. Their success is our success. Our plastics and chemicals are building blocks that help make everyday essentials safer and more sustainable, and we constantly strive to develop new and innovative products to meet the future needs of our customers. And that customer focus doesn’t only apply to the marketplace – it also applies to how we treat our colleagues and our fellow community members.

Better every day . We invest in our people and our processes to improve every day. A2E, our continuous improvement program, guides the way we do business. And this way of problem solving applies not only to our manufacturing practices but also to our commitment to developing our people. You’ll see it during your career at Ascend in our leadership development, skills training and mentoring programs

Agile . We think broadly and lead proactively in a constantly evolving organization and industry. Agility doesn’t mean simply working quickly – it means critical thinking, creative problem solving and novel approaches to everyday challenges.

One Ascend . All together, with a common set of goals and an eye toward the future. We don’t accept silos. We look for ways to share across departments, sites and geography. This means you won’t be boxed into a single role at Ascend – you could get the chance to work with teams across the globe to improve the way we serve our people, our customers and our communities.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, citizenship, genetic information or other protected status under federal, state or local laws.

Responsible for answering, evaluating, prioritizing, and assigning incoming telephone, voice mail, e-mail, and in-person requests for assistance from users experiencing problems with hardware, software, networking, and other computer-related technologies. Full Job Description
About Our Company

Morf3D is a metal additive manufacturing (AM) supplier for the aerospace industry, focused on the manufacture and certification of production flight hardware to customer requirements. Our objective is to support industry growth through the adoption of AM technology into the design lifecycle by providing development and application of AM design and material technologies.
Position Overview

The Software Engineering Intern will assist in the programming and development of internal project management systems. Using Flask, Microsoft SQL Server, and basic front-end (HTML, CSS, JS) technologies, the Software Engineering Intern will be responsible for writing code which supports the front-end, back-end, and optimization of legacy code. Because these internal project management systems are used by teams across the organization, this role requires an individual who can accommodate input, requests, and questions from non-technical employees. This role will also be project-based and will require an individual who can work independently with the support of a small team.

The Software Engineering Intern will report to the CTO, through the Lead Software Engineer.

Responsibilities

Responsible for writing clean code according to best practices

Responsible for collaboration with team members to strengthen personal technical capabilities and developing software solutions which meet the needs of the organization

Responsible for maintaining a professional and friendly manner

Job Duties

Develops web systems by designing, developing, testing, and maintaining software solutions

Documents and demonstrates solutions by developing documentation, code comments, and clear code

Confer with engineers, managers, technicians, quality engineers and inspectors, manufacturing technicians, and other technical and customer related services as needed to develop software solutions or to select appropriate solutions

Reports about project status and updates to management and relevant stakeholders

Skills

REQUIRED: Python (Intermediate level)

REQUIRED: HTML, CSS, JS (Intermediate level)

REQUIRED: SQL (Basic)

PREFERRED: Flask

PREFERRED: Git for version control

Strong logic and reasoning to perform trade-offs and solution complex problems

Strong sense of collaboration, with a spirit towards problem-solving

Education / Experience / General Requirements

In-Progress Bachelor's degree (Computer Systems, Computer Science, Math OR Software Engineering)

PREFERRED: 2+ years of experience in software development

REQUIRED: Compliant with the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) which requires U.S. person status (ITAR defines "U.S. Person" as a U.S. Citizen or U.S. Permanent Resident

Work Environment and Safety Requirements

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounter while performing the essential functions of the job.

Ability to wear personal protective gear correctly for up to one hour, including gloves, hearing protection, eye protection, protective footwear, and respirators

Ability to learn technical material relating to software systems

Ability to remain in a stationary position for up to three hours

Ability to operate digital applications on an interface, such as a tablet or smartphone

Ability to communicate with teammates and internal stakeholders with daily updates, hazard concerns, questions, and issues

Morf3D is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. We believe that a diverse workforce creates an environment in which unique ideas are developed and differing perspectives are valued, producing superior customer solutions. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, color, religion, genetic information, marital status, ancestry, national origin, protected veteran status, physical disability, medical condition, mental disability, or disability status and any other characteristic protected by state or federal law.

Before applying, please note: Morf3D is an ITAR-compliant Company. Applicants MUST be a U.S. citizen as defined by ITAR (22 CFR 120.15) or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State.

position: SAP iXp Intern, SAP Intelligent Robotic Process Automation
description:
Full Job Description
Requisition ID: 291330
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP

1. Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.

2. Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.

3. Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs, and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team:
The SAP Intelligent Robotic Process Automation (RPA) unit consists of a dynamic, fast-growing, and innovative young team in three locations. The goal with our product is to automate business processes that are by nature tedious and manual. SAP Intelligent RPA as an automation suite provides technology to design, orchestrate, run and monitor software robots. The users of our software are at the center of our development processes.

What you’ll do:
Position Title: SAP iXp Intern, SAP Intelligent Robotic Process Automation
Location: Palo Alto, California
Expected start date to end date: August 16, 2021

In this role, you’ll:
We are looking for an intern with high availability who supports the go-to-market and solution management team mastering the high demand and interest in our fast-growing product. You will be involved in go-to-market content creation for resonating with customer needs in the area of intelligent process automation. This role will include understanding SAP´s product launch processes, how to market the product in detail, how to differentiate and position it to customers and enable commercialization processes around that on reporting, content creation, and stakeholder interaction
Work with the solution management team to consolidate information on customer numbers, adoption, and use cases
Build Robotic Process Automation scenarios, release developed scenarios to a broader audience in the form of presentations, videos, demos, customer stories, and other product material
Get hands-on knowledge on the Robotic Process Automation solution and document the best practices
Consolidate feedback from the solution management team on market requirements and collaborate with product management for influencing product roadmap
Be an active member of the solution management team,
Closely collaborate with international development and product management team and support promoting an innovative SAP solution

Who you are:
We’re looking for someone who can challenge the status quo and likes to stay curious. You enjoy working on meaningful projects and are energized by lifelong learning.
Student (f/m/d) at a university or a university of applied sciences with preferred fields of study: computer science
Knowledge of Robotic Process Automation, workflow scripting, Javascript programming is required
Business process knowledge in one of the functional areas such as finance or procurement or human resources or information technology
Attention to detail, creativity, and problem-solving capabilities
Highly interested in learning cloud software applications and a team player with a passion for understanding,
Documenting use cases and structure them
Ability to work independently; demonstrating commitment and a sense of responsibility; flexibility and readiness to learn new skills at short notice
Ability to plan, prioritize and organize work effectively and efficiently
Previous work experience in a similar position is beneficial but not mandatory

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT

Full Job Description
Organization and Job ID

Job ID: 312230

Directorate: National Security

Division: Computing & Analytics

Group:Operations and Analysis

Job Description

Pacific Northwest National Lab (PNNL) is seeking undergraduate students for the opportunity to be a cyber security intern working alongside a team of Cyber Security Engineers, Analysts, and Researchers to generate creative solutions for government sponsors through a full development lifecycle including planning, design, and implementation. The candidate will get exposure to creating solutions from the ground up which requires working through complex technical challenges. The incumbent is organizationally part of the Operations & Analysis Group. This Group is a part of the National Security Directorate and provides high quality technology and analysis products to the U.S. Department of Energy and other federal agencies. This position is located in the Washington, DC area.

Responsibilities and accountabilities include:
Installation and/or maintenance of hardware and software components

Configuration of network switches, routers, and firewalls

Installation, Configuration, and Support of Operating Systems including Microsoft Windows, and Linux

Follow standard operational procedures to install, patch, or upgrade Operating Systems and Software components

Utilize Jira, Confluence, and other Atlassian suite tools to track tasks and documentation

Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to team and collaborate effectively with others

Able to deliver results with the highest level of professionalism and integrity

Minimum Qualifications

Candidates must be degree-seeking students enrolled at an accredited college or university. Candidates must be taking at least 6 credit hours and have an overall GPA of 2.5.

Preferred Qualifications

Relevant experience in cyber security, computer science, or closely related field

Experience working national security missions

Must have demonstrated interpersonal skills

Ability to interact professionally with sponsors

Current active DOD TS/SCI or DOE Q/SCI

Special/Hazardous Working Conditions or Environment

This position will require occasional work around electrical computer cabinets that may include installing computer, network, and other components.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Battelle Memorial Institute (BMI) at Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL) is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer and supports diversity in the workplace. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital or family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or genetic information. All BMI staff must be able to demonstrate the legal right to work in the United States. BMI is an E-Verify employer. Learn more at jobs.pnnl.gov.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via https://jobs.pnnl.gov/help.stm

Please be aware that the Department of Energy (DOE) prohibits DOE employees and contractors from having any affiliation with the foreign government of a country DOE has identified as a “country of risk” without explicit approval by DOE and Battelle. If you are offered a position at PNNL and currently have any affiliation with the government of one of these countries you will be required to disclose this information and recuse yourself of that affiliation or receive approval from DOE and Battelle prior to your first day of employment.

Other Information

This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a federal security clearance.

Requirements:
U.S. Citizenship

Background Investigation: Applicants selected will be subject to a Federal background investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified matter in accordance 10 CFR 710, Appendix B.

Drug Testing: All Security Clearance (L or Q) positions will be considered by the Department of Energy to be Testing Designated Positions which means that they are subject to applicant, random, and for cause drug testing. In addition, applicants must be able to demonstrate non-use of illegal drugs, including marijuana, for the 12 consecutive months preceding completion of the requisite Questionnaire for National Security Positions (QNSP).

Note: Applicants will be considered ineligible for security clearance processing by the U.S. Department of Energy until non-use of illegal drugs, including marijuana, for 12 consecutive months can be demonstrated.

This position will require the ability to obtain and maintain an SCI clearance. Applicants must be U. S. citizens, no dual citizenship, and have no foreign national immediate family members. Work location will be primarily in Washington, DC, with travel determined by project need.

Full Job Description
JOB
The Sacramento Area Council of Governments is seeking a tech-savvy student, interested in research and analysis, for a summer (and optional fall) paid Internship to join the Transportation Modeling and Analysis Team. The candidate would support the latest update to the regional Travel Demand Model for the Sacramento region. As a regional planning agency, the travel model is used as a key tool for the regions long range planning, transportation project evaluation, and air quality conformity requirements.All applicants are required to be enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate level program at a college or university. All work will be performed remotely. Work may be performed from anywhere within the State of California. Option to work from the office will be contingent on SACOG office reopening schedule and protocol. Hours are flexible, minimum of 20 hours per week during the summer and 10 hours during the fall. Salary is based on number of units completed and any prior work experience.Why join SACOG?The dynamic nature of our work – we are a small, flexible, and diverse staff that serves a voluntary association of city and county governments that provide a forum for mutual problem solving and regional advancement.We encourage professional development and growth, as well as, promote job satisfaction and personal fulfillment in which talents are fully utilized and uniqueness is valued.We have a flat organizational structure – collaborative, achievement-oriented teams are the focal point of all of our project work. Our team members come from a range of backgrounds that bring a variety of ideas, perspectives and experiences to help contribute to our innovative and collaborative environment.We are committed to our organizational values – professional excellence, innovation, integrity, leadership, trust, mutual respect, accountability, teamwork, collaboration, open communication, and personal growth.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Geographical Informational Systems (GIS) and travel demand model network editingResearch emerging best practices for complex data structuresPreform spatial statistical analysis and modeling calibration tasksCreate summary and tracking tables for analysis and reportingAttend weekly internal data analysis team and project meetings (online), sharing work with team during meetings

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum Qualifications: Enrolled in an undergraduate or graduate level program field of study relating to transportation, urban planning, data analytics, computer science and technology or related fields at a college or university.Excel proficiency.Geographical Informational Systems (GIS) experience.Desired Skills: Modeling knowledge or experience.Database management and or programming experience.Ability to understand and present technical information.Strong analytical, social and communication skills.Enjoy research, analysis and learning new things.Detail oriented and adaptable to work in a fast paced environment.

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION
Any combination of experience and training that would likely provide the required knowledge and abilities is qualifying.No experience required.Training: Interns must be enrolled in relevant subject courses in an undergraduate or graduate program.

Full Job Description
Overview:
NV5 (NASDAQ: NVEE) is a provider of engineering and consulting services to public and private sector clients, delivering solutions through six business verticals: Testing, Inspection & Consulting; Infrastructure; Utility Services; Environmental Health Sciences; Buildings & Program Management; and Geospatial Technology. With offices nationwide and abroad, NV5 helps clients plan, design, build, test, certify, and operate projects that improve the communities where we live and work.

As engineers, architects, construction/program managers, environmental professionals and beyond, we play a significant role in shaping our communities through the services we provide. We are looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team focused on Delivering Solutions and Improving Lives.

Job Summary:
The Software Developer Intern will contribute to the company by working closely with internal employees to improve, extend, and debug existing internal applications. The intern will work directly with the IT Manager to learn about the software development lifecycle, from coding to testing to deployment.

Responsibilities:
Develop and debug internal applications in C#, VB.NET, and SQL.
Provide end-user support for internal applications.

Qualifications:
Ideally a junior or senior pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Some experience with C#, VB.NET, and SQL Server.
Some experience working in Visual Studio 2019.
Exposure to AWS and Microsoft Azure a plus.

NV5 offers a competitive compensation and benefits package including medical, dental, life insurance, PTO, 401(k) and professional development/advancement opportunities.

NV5 provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, creed, citizenship status, ancestry, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. NV5 complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Full Job Description
Job Summary

The National Security Agency (NSA) Science of Security (SoS) Summer Internship Program offers paid research internship opportunities for undergraduate and graduate-level university students pursuing STEM degrees. The 12-week program starting mid-May/June offers interns the opportunity to gain hands-on experience working with full-time NSA researchers on innovative cybersecurity research and technology. NSA/CSS Research Directorate (RES) is home to a highly technical and talented workforce that performs cutting-edge research and creates breakthroughs in mathematics, computer science, engineering, cybersecurity, physics, neuroscience, and linguistics that lead to creative solutions to NSA's most challenging problems.

Qualifications

' Must be a U.S. citizen.
' Must be eligible to be granted a security clearance.
' Must be available for an operational interview and other applicable processing between the months of November 2021 and March 2022.
' Applicants should have demonstrated superior STEM aptitude and problem-solving skills. Evidence of successful work on an independent STEM project is desirable. Applicants may be at any stage in their undergraduate or graduate careers and working, or intending to work, in any STEM area.
' Desired majors include, but not restricted to, computer science, cybersecurity, engineering, information technology, mathematics, and psychology.

Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule

  • Students are paid a competitive salary commensurate with their education level.
  • Receive annual leave, sick leave and paid federal holidays.
  • Participation in agency-wide extracurricular programs.
  • Students who attend schools in excess of 75 miles from Ft. Meade, MD, are eligible for a round trip airfare ticket to and from school or mileage reimbursement up to the cost of a government-issued airline ticket.
  • Daily transportation to and from work is not provided. Students participating in the program are highly encouraged to bring a vehicle. Carpooling with other students MAY be available but NOT guaranteed.
  • Subsidized housing accommodations are available upon request if school is located in excess of 75 miles from NSA main HQs campus.
How to apply

Submit an online application on or before 31 October 2021.

Send an applicant package to sos.research@nsa.gov; you will receive an email confirmation upon receipt.

Applicant packages should include:
' Resume,
' One page essay on the applicant research experience and/or interests,
' Most recent transcript(s) that show academic performance - Unofficial copies are accepted, and
' A letter of recommendation (LOR) from a faculty member or research mentor who can speak to your research experience/background (LORs attached to the application package or sent directly from the recommender to sos.research@nsa.gov are accepted).

Early Acceptance Incentive;
The application period runs until 31 October 2021. However, the Agency will determine selections for early acceptance into the program on a rolling basis throughout the application period and anticipates filling approximately 1/3 of the available positions prior to the closing of the application period.

If you have questions about the Science of Security Intern Program, please contact us at the email address above or call 1-844-ICHIRES. You may also e-mail Summer_Interns@nsa.gov for application questions.

***PLEASE NOTE:
U.S. Citizenship is required for all applicants. Reasonable accommodations provided to applicants with disabilities during the application and hiring process where appropriate. NSA is an equal opportunity employer and abides by applicable employment laws and regulations. All applicants and employees are subject to random drug testing in accordance with Executive Order 12564. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a security background investigation and polygraph.

This position is a Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS) position in the Excepted Service under 10 U.S.C. 1601. DoD Components with DCIPS positions apply Veterans' Preference to eligible candidates as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 USC, in accordance with the procedures provided in DoD Instruction 1400.25, Volume 2005, DCIPS Employment and Placement. If you are a veteran claiming veterans' preference, as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 U.S.C., you may be asked to submit documents verifying your eligibility.

DCIPS Disclaimer

The National Security Agency (NSA) is part of the DoD Intelligence Community Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS). All positions in the NSA are in the Excepted Services under 10 United States Codes (USC) 1601 appointment authority.

Full Job Description

At the City of Sugar Land, we are looking for people driven by a desire to contribute, possess a willingness to be challenged, and are committed to public service. Our champion employees are a driving factor for making Sugar Land "One of America's Best".

Summary of Duties: The City of Sugar Land is seeking students for an internship opportunity who are currently completing coursework towards a Bachelor's Degree or a Master's Degree in a variety of fields related to the operation of a municipality. The program consists of up to a 12-week, paid full-time internship. Interns may have an opportunity to work in a variety of departments such as those listed below in the "Additional Information" section.

Projects and work assignments vary by department and are designed to give the Intern a broad, positive experience in municipal government. Through the City's internship program, Interns can:

  • Enhance your resume.
  • Investigate your own personal interest and goals.
  • Expand your knowledge of local government.
  • Network with government professionals.
  • Investigate your future career path.
  • Apply, Challenge & Develop intellect and your knowledge base.

Minimum Qualifications: Applicants must be completing coursework towards a Bachelor's or Master's Degree in public administration, business administration, or a variety of fields related to the operation of a municipality. Individuals who recently completed a degree within a 6-month period from their graduation date may be considered for this program. Applicants should possess an interest in government service, and provide documentation of leadership, interpersonal skills, and participation in team projects.
Additional Information: Internship Opportunities
We have a variety of departments that requested a 2021 Summer Intern. The departments are listed below with a brief description of what projects they have available:
The ideal candidate would be pursuing a degree in Biology, Veterinary Medicine, Animal Science, Environmental Science or Public Administration.

Parks & Recreation Intern
Some projects may include:

  • Assisting with the Brazos River Corridor Master Plan and the Butterfly Garden
  • Assisting with the planning, implementing and post event activities for special city-wide events

The ideal candidate would be pursuing a degree in Parks & Recreation, Landscape Architecture Design, Environmental Design, Planning or Public Administration.

Information Technology Intern
Some projects may include:

  • Support the ERP Project Manager with planning, scheduling, and organization
  • Detailed Invoice Review
  • Communicate and prioritize daily issue logs for all phases

The ideal candidate would be pursuing a degree in Computer Science or Business Degree.

Emergency Management
Some projects may include:

  • Common Operational Picture Job Aid
  • EOC Staff Job Aids
  • Emergency Operations Plan Framework

Public Affairs Intern
Some projects may include:

  • Conceptualize and design graphics that inform residents of key messages and reoccurring topics.

The ideal candidate would be pursuing a degree in Graphic Design or Communications.

Economic Development Intern
Some projects may include:

  • Assisting with components of the Retail Redevelopment Strategic Project

The ideal candidate would be pursuing a degree in Planning, Geography, Architecture, Business or Sociology.

Human Resources /Risk Management Intern
Some projects may include:

  • Auditing insurance schedules
  • Assisting with conducting facility schedules

The ideal candidate would be pursuing a degree in Risk Management or Human Resources.

Public Works Intern
Some projects may include:

  • Collecting field data and reviewing construction plans.

The ideal candidate would be pursuing a degree in Construction Science or Urban Planning.

Environment Neighborhood Services

  • Visible assessment of the physical conditions of animals
  • Weighing animals
  • Accurately document medical information/treatment on appropriate forms
  • Assist Vet Tech with conducting tests and administering medications and medical treatments

The ideal candidate would be pursuing a degree in Biology, Veterinary Medicine, Animal Science, Environmental Science or Public Administration.

Full Job Description

Job Description

Company Information

Smarter Grid Solutions (SGS) is a fast-growing technology company that delivers products and services to enable utilities and developers to integrate distributed and renewable energy resources into our electric grid. Our unique Active Network Management (ANM) technology is the only technology of its kind to provide real-time, autonomous control of distributed energy resources, and is the result of over ten years of developing, deploying and proving this unique approach to managing the Smart Grid.

Overview

SGS is seeking a Software Analytics Intern to join our smart grid analytics team. The team is responsible for developing practical paths to operationalizing advanced power systems analytics; this could be battery optimization techniques, ML-based forecasting, or integration with advanced network-model based approaches based on load flow, optimal power flow, or state estimation. All of these power systems techniques can be used to help manage the grid more optimally and pave the way for deeper de-carbonization.

We are looking for a highly motivated student or graduate with excellent software development skills to help build out our analytical capabilities. In this group, you will sit between the world of software development, power systems, and advanced analytics. Your focus will be on helping develop and test software frameworks that give us and our customers confidence that these complex analytics can be safely operationalized. You will be involved in end-to-end software development in a multi-disciplinary environment.

Qualifying Criteria

**Please note we cannot consider applications from candidates who do not meet these criteria.**

You must be either a NY State resident attending or having attended any college or university, regardless of location, within the last 12 months

or

an out of state student, attending or having attended a College or university located in New York State within the last 12 months.

Required Skills

· Strong academic track record in Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Computer Science, or similar

· Familiarity with high-level power and energy systems concepts

· Solid experience in modern analytics-friendly languages like Python, Scala, or R

Desired Skills

There are a number of additional desirable attributes that would complement the required skillset:

  • An understanding of power systems analysis
  • Optimization using AMPL, GAMS, or similar
  • AI and ML techniques
  • First principles understanding of algorithms, data structures, and time/space complexity

Anticipated Start Date: Summer 2021.

Duration: Minimum of 6 months.

Salary: Competitive

Job Type: Internship

Location: New York

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: $17.00 per hour

BDO’s Core Purpose is Helping People Thrive Every Day. Our Core Values reflect how we manage our work, our relationships and ourselves. Full Job Description
On behalf of DFO Global Performance Commerce - its subsidiary agency, Amasa. DFO is on a mission to deliver superior eCommerce software, marketing, and products to make the world a better place.

ABOUT AMASA:
Amasa is a rapidly expanding digital marketing agency that is responsible for some of the most successful and innovative media and ecommerce campaigns online. We are expert, performance marketers who can complete the impossible when it comes to high volume global digital sales. We’ve tripled our growth in the past year, and are looking to go even further with amazing people like yourself!

Amasa is headquartered in downtown San Diego, CA.

OVERVIEW:
Are you a recent graduate looking to enter the fast-paced world of digital marketing and e-commerce? Want to learn how to craft digital marketing strategies for clients spending thousands per day on Facebook, Google, and through other programmatic online ad exchanges?

Eager to know how a multi-million dollar ecommerce agency is run and help real clients grow their business on day 1?

If so, you might be a fit for our internship program at Amasa. This internship will involve both remote work, and some socially-distant collaboration at our Gaslamp district office downtown. The office is regularly cleaned and sanitized, and we are following all CDC protocols for social distancing and safe reopening.

We are looking for smart, data-driven and creative young talent to train, then hopefully hire FULL TIME for our growing agency, in the role of either an Junior Account Manager or a Junior Facebook Media Buyer

In this role, you will:
Plan, manage, and execute digital media buys on Facebook and Instagram
Develop a collaborative relationship with internal and external creative teams to develop cutting-edge media assets.
Constantly learn and experiment new effective bidding, ad placement, and management techniques
Prepare research and insights to inform ongoing media recommendations
Learn to continuously monitor campaign performance and return-on-ad-spend (ROAS), while suggesting and executing ongoing optimization strategies to hit and exceed assigned KPIs
Learn project management tools and software
Assist with developing custom marketing proposals to both startups and global brands
Brainstorm and suggest marketing angles for clients
Perform administrative duties for meetings and other client related tasks
Learn how to A/B test ad creatives and various website components
Help with video and creative shoots
Create and analyze campaign performance reports to inform relevant teams at Amasa.
Perform other related duties as required or assigned

REQUIREMENTS:
Degree in one of the following subjects preferred: Business, Marketing, Statistics, Computer Science, Finance/Accounting, Psychology, Public Relations
Ability to come into the office 2x per week, and work remote (20-25 hours per week total)
Must be creative and have the desire to sell somebody something
Enjoy wearing many hats and managing several projects at one time
Strong communication skills
Computer proficiency
Social media savvy

BENEFITS:
Company issued Macbook Pro or PC
Office stocked with snacks, drinks, and beer
Work alongside awesome young talent and learn real world skills that are transferable to dozens of high earning jobs in a number of fields
Free parking

ADDITIONAL INFO:
Full-time employment potential after 3 months
Position Opening Date: Immediate

Company Information

PACCAR is a Fortune 500 company established in 1905. PACCAR Inc. is recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields with internationally recognized brands such as Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacture and customer support of high-quality light-, medium-, and heavy-duty trucks under the Kenworth, Peterbilt and DAF nameplates. PACCAR also designs and manufactures advanced diesel engines, provides financial services and information technology, and distributes truck parts related to its principal business.

Full Job Description
Job Summary of Roles and Responsibilities

POWER Engineers is currently seeking a talented Computer Science student for a summer internship. Under the guidance of a highly skilled engineering team, the successful candidate will learn how to develop a network discovery tool that leverages open source applications in a Linux or Windows environment.

This will be a great opportunity for a self-motivated student interested in cybersecurity and IOT to learn more about POWER’s Protection and Controls services. Potential for long-term, part-time employment as well as full-time after graduation. Flexible work environment (hybrid between home/university/POWER Engineers’ Systems Lab located in Meridian, Idaho)

Required Education/Experience
Pursuit of a degree in the field of computer science, information science, or related technical field from an accredited university
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing
Attention to detail and ability to thoroughly think through problems
U.S. Citizenship required for federally funded project work
Desired Education/Experience
Minimum GPA of 3.0
Prior internship and/or related cybersecurity background is highly desired
Understanding of basic ethernet network topologies (ring, star, hybrid, etc.)
Proficiency in Linux scripting and coding in Java and C – this will be simple order of operations scripting and operator interface coding.
Proficiency in Windows scripting or coding to automate tasks – open to a wide variety of options from VBA to Perl
Understanding of Windows domain configuration
Experience with server virtualization using VMWare

At POWER Engineers, Inc., you can have a rewarding career on every level. In addition to challenging and meaningful work, you’ll have the chance to make a positive impact on the environment, participate in a range of diverse and unique initiatives, and find the support, coaching, and training it takes to advance your career. We encourage new ideas and fresh approaches, and most importantly, we strive to be our clients’ first choice. These traits – and deep technical skill – account for our success.

Have fun, do good work, make money. As an employee-owned company, we strive to make POWER Engineers an appealing place to work, where we perform projects that we find challenging and in which we excel. We provide competitive compensation, a full benefits package, professional development, and an appealing work environment. POWER Engineers is a unique and fun engineering firm, which may be contradictory to some, but it works well for us.

Full Job Description
Overview:
NV5 (NASDAQ: NVEE) is a provider of engineering and consulting services to public and private sector clients, delivering solutions through six business verticals: Testing, Inspection & Consulting; Infrastructure; Utility Services; Environmental Health Sciences; Buildings & Program Management; and Geospatial Technology. With offices nationwide and abroad, NV5 helps clients plan, design, build, test, certify, and operate projects that improve the communities where we live and work.

As engineers, architects, construction/program managers, environmental professionals and beyond, we play a significant role in shaping our communities through the services we provide. We are looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team focused on Delivering Solutions and Improving Lives.

Job Summary:
The Software Developer Intern will contribute to the company by working closely with internal employees to improve, extend, and debug existing internal applications. The intern will work directly with the IT Manager to learn about the software development lifecycle, from coding to testing to deployment.

Develop and debug internal applications in C#, VB.NET, and SQL.
Provide end-user support for internal applications.

Ideally a junior or senior pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Some experience with C#, VB.NET, and SQL Server.
Some experience working in Visual Studio 2019.
Exposure to AWS and Microsoft Azure a plus.

NV5 offers a competitive compensation and benefits package including medical, dental, life insurance, PTO, 401(k) and professional development/advancement opportunities.

NV5 provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, creed, citizenship status, ancestry, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. NV5 complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

position: Computer Science/Electrical Engineering Development Summer Intern V
description:
Full Job Description
About our group:
We lead Seagate's consumer product division focusing on next-gen data storage and user experience.

About the role - you will:
Areas of Interest: NVMe, USB3.1 Gen 1/2, Thunderbolt, SATA, SAS, Fiber Channel, 10G Ethernet, RAID, Debug, System Performance Test, Python

Are you an Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Computer Engineering undergrad student seeking an exciting summer 2021 internship and looking for an opportunity to leave a lasting impression in the consumer space?

We are looking for students ready to roll up their sleeves and help build game-changing products over the course of a 12 week summer internship at our Fremont Research Center. We are looking for students excited to help solve big problems and join a team with equally motivated co-workers. This is an awesome opportunity to work on early stage product development, solving real consumer issues. Responsibilites include:

Have the opportunity to help develop, test, and debug our cutting edge Consumer Electronic and Data Center Products
Help to characterize system performance and usage models for various storage technologies, propose methods to optimize data throughput
Support Research activities for other Advanced Development projects

Our summer interns typically work Monday thru Friday 8am to 5pm. The hours are subject to change with or without notice at the sole discretion of Seagate. Weekly communications with overseas design teams may be necessary.

About you:
Our ideal intern candidate must be a self-directed team player who thrives in a continually changing environment and has the following attributes and experience:
Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Computer Engineering and returning to school in fall 2021
Excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to work well in a team environment are essential to succeed in this role.
Great interpersonal skills and the ability to build consensus is a must
Excellent analytical and debug skills
Strong Electrical/Computer Engineering fundamentals with demonstrated ability to apply these skills to solve difficult real world problems
Experience with Network System Performance Testing and Script Writing a plus
Experience with various OS such as Linux, Unix, Windows and MacOS a plus
Experience with NVMe, USB3.1 Gen 1/2, Thunderbolt, SATA, Debug, System Test a plus
Experience with high speed interfaces and Hardware Testing a plus

Location:
Location: Fremont, CA

Our Gold LEED-certified Fremont product-design campus drives innovation, bringing together a diverse set of engineering, design, operations, support and administrative teams. The site is equipped with state-of-the-art clean room and lab space. On-site social activities are popular, including our annual BBQ, ice cream social, and holiday events. Wellness programs, gaming rooms and the on-site fitness center help round out and balance your Seagate work-life experience, along with opportunities to give back to our local community.

  • Good written and verbal communication skills with focus on customer satisfaction

position: Project Management Data Analyst Fall Intern
description:
Full Job Description
About Osmose

With 85 years of experience, Osmose proudly serves the electric utility and telecommunications industries across the U.S., helping enable the delivery of safe, reliable and affordable electricity and communications services to millions of customers nationwide. We are the industry leader in wood and steel structure condition assessment, life-extension and rehabilitation services. Our mission is to accurately inspect and mitigate aging infrastructure in a planned, programmatic manner that minimizes owner costs while maximizing benefits.

Headquartered in Peachtree City, Georgia, with satellite offices in Atlanta, Buffalo, Syracuse and Boston, the Osmose footprint extends throughout the country. Our employees are inspired to perform each and every day by our core values of integrity, customer focus, safety, respect, excellence, flexibility, efficiency and ownership. Our staff and field personnel represent some of the most tenured, well trained, and innovative professionals in the industry.

Osmose is currently seeking a Data Analyst Intern in our Project Management Department to become an integral part of our team this Fall! You will analyze data to understand business and market trends in order to increase company revenue and efficiency.

This position is based at our corporate office in Peachtree City, GA. Pay is between $14 - $17 per hour.

Preference will be given to student pursuing a bachelor’s degree in industrial engineering, math or computer science with focus on database management.

Responsibilities
Generate project dashboards and reports
Use data to understand business patterns and trends
Analyze internal and external data through quantitative research
Communicate findings to company through standard and ad hoc reports
Promote best practices in data analysis and reporting
Collaborate with cross-functional teams
Qualifications
Previous experience in business intelligence, analysis, or other related field
Knowledge of statistical tools and business reporting
Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills
Strong attention to detail
Ability to prioritize and multitask
Must be a self-starter with proficiency in MS Excel, MS Word, MS PowerPoint, and the ability to lead presentations with confidence
Candidates with basic programming experience with tools such as MATLAB are preferred

Osmose is an Equal Opportunity employer. EOE M/F/Disabled/Vet

Full Job Description
Why Product Security?

As an intern on Zendesk’s Product Security team, you’ll partner with senior team members and Zendesk engineers to prioritize security during the software development process. You’ll improve the tools and programs we use to prevent, identify, and address security issues. The experience you’ll gain from this hands-on role will be indispensable in your future security career.

What you’ll be doing everyday:
Security Projects:
Build and deploy tools to identify vulnerabilities and threats or streamline our Security Operations workflows

Respond to identified threats

Security Reviews:
Perform threat modeling to identify threats and solutions

Vulnerability Triage

Verify vulnerabilities from the suite of security tools and penetration tests that we use to secure our platforms

File vulnerability reports and track them until they are fixed

What you need to succeed:
Pursuing a bachelors or masters degree or equivalent experience ( Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a security-specific program )

Familiarity with common application security vulnerabilities such as the OWASP Top 10 or the SANS 25

Familiarity with programming languages (Python, R, Java, Ruby etc.)

Strong passion for application security

That said, if your experience looks a little different from what we’ve identified and you think you can rock the role, we’d love to learn more about you.

Zendesk started the customer experience revolution in 2007 by enabling any business around the world to take their customer service online. Today, Zendesk is the champion of great service everywhere for everyone, and powers billions of conversations, connecting more than 100,000 logos with hundreds of millions of customers over telephony, chat, email, messaging, social channels, communities, review sites and help centers. Zendesk products are built with love to be loved. The company was conceived in Copenhagen, Denmark, built and grown in California, taken public in New York City, and today employs more than 4,000 people across the world. Learn more at www.zendesk.com.

We believe in service. Learn more about how we provide support to our local communities with volunteering, grants and product donations.

Orolia, the world leader in Resilient Positioning, Navigation and Timing (PNT) solutions, always has great opportunities for students to intern with our company and work side by side with our innovative engineers.

Orolia is looking for Interns enrolled in a four-year or post-graduate degree program in the following fields:

Electrical Engineering
Computer Engineering
Computer Science
Signal Processing
Radio Communications

Our technology at Orolia is innovative and cutting edge. A typical day could be…

Working closely with Lead Engineers in in a lab environment designing the latest GPS-based and alternative PNT equipment and software

Testing new products, new features and software releases to ensure our products meet the highest standards and specifications.

Devising test procedures, experiments, test fixtures and software; performing those tests, analyzing the results and generating comprehensive test reports and recommendations.

Analyzing and debugging problem reports and designing fixes

Working with vendors, subcontractors, and customers to understand their needs and applications toward solving problems in deployments

Working in a multi-discipline, multi-cultural environmental with cross-functional teams toward a common design goal.

Global Collaboration: We pride ourselves on personal excellence through global collaboration, communication and team achievement!

Fun: We are at our best having fun and we bring the best out of each other.

Innovation: We love to develop and implement creative solutions!

Commitment: We persevere in all situations.

Agility: Our business, strategies and our people are ready to adapt to evolving needs of our markets.

Continuous Improvement: We’re curious and we always demonstrate the desire to improve results and challenge the status quo.

Orolia is an international high-tech company dedicated to improving the safety, compliance and efficiency of its global customers’ remote operations by providing them business solutions and services based on the most advanced positioning, navigation, timing, sensing, information, and communications technologies. At Orolia, we continuously look to go “Beyond the Frontier” in everything that we do. Orolia believes that success in the global marketplace requires a variety of perspectives and individual experiences. At Orolia, we understand, appreciate and strive for new and different thoughts and ideas. A high degree of employee involvement, lifelong learning and diversity are permanent items on the agenda throughout the entire organization.

Full Job Description
At BWX Technologies, Inc. (NYSE: BWXT), we are People Strong, Innovation Driven. Headquartered in Lynchburg, Va., BWXT provides safe and effective nuclear solutions for national security, clean energy, environmental remediation, nuclear medicine and space exploration. With approximately 6,400 employees, BWXT has 12 major operating sites in the U.S. and Canada. We are the sole manufacturer of naval nuclear reactors for U.S. submarines and aircraft carriers. Our company supplies precision manufactured components, services and fuel for the commercial nuclear power industry across four continents. Our joint ventures provide environmental remediation and nuclear operations management at more than a dozen U.S. Department of Energy and NASA facilities. BWXT’s technology is driving advances in medical radioisotope production in North America and microreactors for various defense and space applications. Follow us on Twitter at @BWXTech and learn more at www.bwxt.com.

JOB DESCRIPTION | R&D Software Intern

Experian Fraud and ID analytics team is an Experian division formed to combat all kinds of fraud that our financial, telecom, and other credit issuer clients’ experience. Experian® is a global leader in providing information, analytical tools and marketing services to organizations and consumers to help manage the risk and reward of commercial and financial decisions. Using our comprehensive understanding of individuals, markets and economies, we help organizations find, develop and manage customer relationships to make their businesses more profitable.

About us, but we’ll be brief

Experian is the world’s leading global information services company, unlocking the power of data to create more opportunities for consumers, businesses and society. We are thrilled to share that FORTUNE has named Experian one of the 100 Best Companies to work for. In addition, for the last five years we’ve been name in the 100 “World’s Most Innovative Companies” by Forbes Magazine.

What you’ll be doing

The intern must have a very solid understanding of programming and to understand high-level requirements and then utilize their software development knowledge and experience to design and implement these requirements in Python, and Java. The Fraud and ID Software intern should be able to work with other team members and be able to work independently and make recommendations on approaches and evaluate various solutions. Utilize programming skills (Python, Java, etc.) to develop data processing, data manipulation, and automation tools

Experience with online forms, web applications, and web services
Basic knowledge concerning with Hadoop and NoSQL related technologies such as Map Reduce, Spark, Hive, Pig, HBase, mongoDB, Cassandra, etc.
Knowledge in SAS

Perks

Competitive pay and comprehensive benefits package
Flexible work schedule and relaxed dress code

Experian is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Our goal is to create a thriving, inclusive and diverse team where people love their work and love working together. We believe that diversity, equity and inclusion is essential to our purpose of creating a better tomorrow. Provide input for process improvement and standardization

Strong computer skills and the ability to create high-value deliverables

Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work within a team environment
Self starter who can think ahead

The Assured Software and Information Division within the Georgia Tech Research Institute (GTRI) seeks an intern for the fall 2021 semester to research techniques in data characterization and data modeling for machine learning projects. This position requires working in Python and evaluating models in open source machine learning platforms, such as PyTorch or Tensorflow. Additional requirements include the ability to prototype example models in at least one of these platforms. This intern will work within a diverse team of mathematicians, physicists, computer scientists, and engineers exploring new ways of representing cyber domain data for machine learning projects. Cybersecurity topic domains include algorithm assurance, software assurance, and cyber-physical systems security. GTRI is the nonprofit applied research arm of the Georgia Institute of Technology (Georgia Tech) and is located in midtown Atlanta on Georgia Tech’s campus.

This opportunity not only provides you the opportunity to gain valuable work experience in a professional environment but also allows you a look at what HII-TSD can offer you as an employee.

Internships are offered in 90 day increments. Students may be invited to remain in the internship program for another 90 days, following an evaluation after the term.

What you will do
Support the IT team in maintaining hardware, software, and other systems in areas such as cybersecurity, programming, analytics, and data center management
Assist with troubleshooting issues and provide technical support
Perform on-site installation/ configuration/ repair/ recovery/ back-up and preventative maintenance on PCs and related peripherals
Assist IT personnel in ensuring that hardware and software systems are fully deployed, implemented, and functioning
What we are looking for
High School Diploma or equivalent + Must be working towards a Bachelor's degree with more than 60% of the required credits completed
Pursuing a Bachelors Degree in the field of computer science, information sciences, or a related field
Moderate understanding of general job aspects and some understanding of the detailed aspects of the job
Clearance- Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance
Bonus Points for...
Active Clearance: TS/SCI
Valid CompTIA Security + certification
Physical Requirements

Job performance will normally require only minor lifting and carrying of boxes of records or equipment.

A division of Huntington Ingalls Industries

This opportunity resides with Defense & Federal Solutions, a business group within Huntington Ingalls Industries’ Technical Solutions division, helps solve tough national security challenges for the Department of Defense, the intelligence community and federal civilian agencies. Our expert capabilities include intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance (ISR), and cyber; secure enterprise IT engineering and operations; military training and simulation; logistics management and integrated product support; and fleet maintenance, modernization, repair and sustainment.

Huntington Ingalls Industries is America’s largest military shipbuilding company and a provider of professional services to partners in government and industry. For more than a century, HII’s Newport News and Ingalls shipbuilding divisions in Virginia and Mississippi have built more ships in more ship classes than any other U.S. naval shipbuilder. HII’s Technical Solutions division provides a wide range of professional services through its Fleet Support, Mission Driven Innovative Solutions, Nuclear & Environmental, and Oil & Gas groups. Headquartered in Newport News, Virginia, HII employs more than 42,000 people operating both domestically and internationally.

Huntington Ingalls Industries is an Equal Opportunity/Vets and Disabled Employer. U.S. Citizenship may be required for certain positions.

Basic Function

As a part of the Innovation team, the Innovation Intern will help deploy and manage innovative solar and energy storage technology pilots at PVUSA, located in Davis, CA.

Responsibilities

· Review of technical documentation and engineering design drawings

· On-site support and management of pilot projects

· Design and perform experiments on solar and energy storage projects

· Develop simulation and physical tests to validate battery performance metrics (SOC, SOH, etc.)

· Run tests on the battery to simulate various use cases (energy, capacity, and ancillary services)

· Performance data collection, analysis, and presentation of results

· Weekly reporting of pilot project status and performance results

· Remain informed on innovative industry trends, companies, and technologies

· Flag and report abnormal output/data and perform technical analysis to identify RC for any deviation.

Qualifications/Requirements

· Currently in a Bachelor’s, Master’s, or PhD program with an emphasis in Electrical, or Mechanical Engineering, Chemistry, Computer Science, Geography, Environmental Science, or Mathematics/Physics required

· Experience with data analysis and presentation, preferably in Python, R, MATLAB, or other programming environment.

· Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Word

· Strong written and verbal English language communication skills

· Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills

· Educational focus on Renewable Energy and/or Energy Storage preferred

· Hands on experience with photovoltaic modules, power electronics, or Li-ion and flow battery systems preferred

· The ability to potentially lift items as heavy as 30lbs.

· Familiar with control methodology for battery system including communication with inverter, DC-DC converters, and relays.

· Excellent debugging and troubleshooting skills to solve challenging problems.

· Strong fundamental knowledge of BMS and EMS functionality and key metrics of battery systems.

· Firmware design experience is a plus.

· Experienced with communication protocols such as MODBUS TCP/IP

· Familiarity with optimization models and forecasting methods (ANL) are preferred.

Travel Requirements

The position requires up to 25% domestic travel and up to 50% onsite presence at pilot projects at PVUSA in Davis, CA

Full Job Description
Company Overview
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.
Business Unit Overview
NetherRealm: The creative team that brought Mortal Kombat and Injustice to life is now NetherRealm Studios, part of the Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment family. With over 20 years of creation under our belts, NetherRealm’s mission remains the same; to create cutting edge entertainment and deliver industry leading tech, game art and overall gaming experiences. NetherRealm Studios is a collaborative and creative environment, constantly striving to up the ante on what is possible in interactive entertainment. We encompass the best of both worlds – a team of dedicated professionals with years of experience, who are also at the forefront of an industry taking over the entertainment landscape. The passion and energy that made Mortal Kombat a reality is still on display every day in our offices, our hallways and most definitely the studio’s arcade room! Monolith: For the past 20 years Monolith has been obsessed with delivering a unique gaming experience for our fans. Starting with Blood, our very first title – all the way to our most recent offering, Middle-Earth: Shadow of Mordor, we are constantly pushing the envelope to combine innovative gameplay, inventive narratives, cutting edge tech & AI, and stunning visuals. We are challenging ourselves even further to ensure that our next game is going to be our best yet. That’s where you come in – for us to achieve that we need the best and brightest talent the industry has to offer. Come join us and help create our next AAA title! Turbine: Founded in 1994, Turbine, Inc., a Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment development studio, is focused on creating free-to-play games for mobile platforms. The studio is utilizing its extensive expertise in creating persistent online worlds that foster powerful social gaming communities to develop its mobile titles, which include Batman™: Arkham Underworld and the upcoming Game of Thrones® mobile game. Avalanche: Avalanche Software was acquired by Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment from Disney in 2016. The studio's first title under WBIE is a companion video game to the upcoming Cars 3, in partnership with Warner Bros., Disney, and Pixar. WB Games SF: Warner Bros. is a top video games publisher across multiple platforms. In mobile games, we have a growing portfolio of hits that includes DC Legends, Mortal Kombat X, and LEGO Star Wars: The Complete Saga, and we continue to expand by adding great people and leveraging the best portfolio of brands and intellectual property in the industry, such as DC Comics, Harry Potter, and LEGO. We are looking to add enthusiastic, talented and experienced professionals to our Mobile Publishing team. WB Games New York: WB Games New York works with some of the top talent in the game industry to build online competitive and social features for video games. Our highly experienced team of engineers utilize cutting-edge technology to build game services that are robust and scalable enough to support world-class developers such as NetherRealm Studios, Rocksteady, Monolith Productions, WB Montréal, and more!
Opportunity Overview
The Job

WB Games Inc. seeks a Data Engineer Intern for the WB Games Boston Data Analytics department.

The WB Games studio is looking for passionate and curious professionals to help level up their data and analytics team. Like us, you love games, and love to have fun. We look for those whose curiosity drives them to try new things, aren’t afraid to fail, and continuously learn.

The Data challenges at WB Games are extensive and you can expect to level up in all data domains. This includes software engineering, cloud-based systems, truly BIG data engineering and analytics.

The Daily

Be part of the game development process, helping teams design and implement analytic-based features.
Learn the internals of building a robust end-to-end data pipeline on all levels especially in databases, data modelling, data processing infrastructure and software development.
Contribute code to production data systems and gain strong software engineering practice.
Gain hands-on experience in distributed data processing technologies: Redshift, Airflow, Presto and Looker.
Learn techniques for high volume distributed data processing and storages.
Ensure the integrity, availability, and confidentiality of data, database systems and supporting services.

The Essentials

You have a drive to learn, ask questions and motivation to find the answers.
You are familiar with one or more of these technologies: Python, PostgreSQL, Go
You are comfortable with DevOps cloud tools (Amazon, EC2, or Google Cloud) and have some working knowledge of monitoring tools
You have side projects or viewable public code on Github, Bitbucket, etc.
You are currently pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical discipline, with an expected graduation date of 2020 or 2021

Bonus Skills

You love games and have checked out our current title
You are well-versed in object-oriented programming (OOP)
You have some experience with Hadoop or other data engineering or database software
You have side projects or viewable public code on Github, Bitbucket, etc.
But Wait, There’s More!
The Perks

  • Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings
  • Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees
  • Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies
  • Access to in-house learning and development resources
  • Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands

Full Job Description
Overview:
UW Credit Union has a great opportunity for an individual aspiring to pursue a career in the information technology field. The IT Desktop Support Intern will be used to augment the IT End User Services staff. The IT Desktop Support Intern will primarily be responsible for assisting the IT End User Services team with receiving, preparing, and deploying client devices, such as laptops, desktop computers, monitors, and other peripheral devices. This may include installing and testing computer equipment, relocating hardware, and hands-on troubleshooting. This person will also be supporting various department projects and activities.

This position is Limited Term. The internship will last 6 months with the opportunity to extend an additional 6 months based on organization/team needs. The individual will work up to 40 hours a week during the summer months and approximately 15-20 hours a week during the school semester. These hours can be flexible to meet your school needs.

The IT Desktop Support Intern must effectively carry out the essential duties of this position in a manner that consistently demonstrates the core values of the Organization in a positive manner.

Responsibilities:
1) Preparing and deploying IT hardware - 50%

Assist the End User Services team by receiving new hardware, tracking inventory, imaging laptops and desktop computers, installing and testing hardware. This includes scheduling and coordinating with end users, following a tested process of updating the Operating System, installing required applications, following provided instructions, testing and troubleshooting as needed. Working with the end user to validate that everything is working to their satisfaction.

2) Office Moves - 20%

Assist with moving staff from one location to another and move staff from one area of a building to another following a move plan and move schedule. This includes disconnecting and reconnecting PCs, monitors and peripherals as well as documenting cable and switchport details.

3) PC Replacements - 30%

Assist with the replacement of Desktop hardware. Coordinate and schedule with end users, the replacement of their desktop PC and decommission the old PC following documented procedures. Work with the end user to validate that everything is working to their satisfaction.

Qualifications:
Pursuing associates or bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field preferred.
A comprehensive working knowledge of Microsoft Windows, Microsoft Office applications, and Outlook preferred.
Experience in providing customer service or support preferred.
The ability to demonstrate strong interpersonal skill, communicate clearly and interact professionally with other employees preferred.
Minimum of 6 months experience in customer service or support required.

UW Credit Union is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer of Minorities, Protected Veterans, Women, and individuals with Disabilities. We strive to cultivate an inclusive workplace that is home to a diverse workforce where employees at all levels model knowledge of, belief in and a commitment to cultural competence.
