Full Job Description
Personalis is a rapidly growing cancer genomics company transforming the development of next-generation therapies by providing more comprehensive molecular data about each patient's cancer and immune response. Our ImmunoID NeXT Platform® is enabling the development of next generation immuno-oncology therapeutics and diagnostics.

Summary:
You will join a team of software quality engineers whose mission is to simplify, modernize and scale business. The business needs robust, high-performance software that can accurately and reliably orchestrate analysis of large volumes of next-generation sequencing (NGS) data. We are offering a summer internship opportunity to promising computer science students who have a professional interest in software engineering. This internship will offer you direct exposure to real world industry applications of software quality engineering to the rapidly growing biotechnology space and will focus on developing you in areas where a computer science curriculum typically does not. The internship will be approximately 8-10 weeks in duration (dates flexible depending on your academic calendar).

Responsibilities:
The objective of this internship program is to gain exposure to best industry practices in software engineering and quality and regulatory standards as applicable to software medical device industry.

You will be responsible for a summer project from conception through feasibility, development, testing and rolling into "production". During the 8-10 weeks program, you will: understand the latest technology and regulatory standards in software engineering, its impact on immuno-oncology, bioinformatics, Next Generation Sequencing and high-performance computing and where you can best focus your academic studies for future career direction.

In this role, you will

Document, review, execute Qualification Protocols (For e.g. Installation, Operation, Performance) related to Computer Systems Software.
Perform periodic review of computer software systems for legacy systems as needed.
Review other Software Quality related documents like Requirements, Procedures, Traceability Matrix,
Develop software quality reports from the tools as needed
Participate in Kanban planning and project related meeting as applicable
Leverage of tools and technologies to develop, review and execute qualification protocols
Present the project to the Personalis Quality Compliance, Research and Development and Operations organization.
Emerge with valuable hands-on industry experience and find him/herself in a fantastic position for a career in the software industry
Work 100% remotely in the Pacific time zone

Requirements:
The ideal candidate will be completing their junior year of undergrad, or first year of graduate school in Engineering and Science and will be returning to school in the fall.
Currently in process of obtaining or recently obtained a B.S. or B.A. in Engineering, Sciences, S.T.E.M.
Some knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle, Computer System Validation, quality record documentation.
Ability to work effectively in a collaborative and dynamic environment.
Knowledge of test management tools, regulatory standards for software medical device, source code management will be bonus.

Submit your resume at https://boards.greenhouse.io/personalisinc by June 15 th , 2021.

Full Job Description
Stonebranch builds dynamic IT automation solutions that transform business IT environments from simple IT task automation into sophisticated, real-time business service automation, helping organizations achieve the highest possible Return on Automation. No matter the degree of automation, Stonebranch software is simple, modern and secure. Using its universal automation platform, enterprises can seamlessly orchestrate workloads and data across technology ecosystems and silos. Headquartered in Alpharetta, Georgia with points of contact and support throughout the Americas, Europe, and Asia, Stonebranch serves some of the world's largest financial, manufacturing, healthcare, travel, transportation, energy, and technology institutions.

Your Part in this Growth Story:
Stonebranch is searching for a Project Management Intern who’s interested in playing in the explosive IT automation market. In this role you will support one or more Project Managers in managing scope, cost, schedule, internal staffing and outside vendors, and contractual deliverables. You will help manage and direct the work of a project team. You will help and support the preparation of project plans, communication plans, kick-off meetings, status meetings, produce status-reports, among others.

The ideal candidate will be interested in understanding how work is coordinated, controlled and carried out when big teams and large infrastructure is involved, is interested in advancing his/her practical experience by following directions from senior resources and dedicating him/herself to the development and knowledge of Project Management practice. Dexterity in dealing with MS Office suite of applications would be highly desired including (MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint and MS Project).

Your Impact on The Organization:
Create, maintain, and communicate project and communication plans and processes.
Plan, communicate and execute kick-off meetings with client and internal resources.
Support the definition and communication of project responsibilities with stakeholders (sponsors, clients, technical staff among others).
Support and carry out the defined Project Plan in terms of resource and budget.
Manage the project tasks, and their individual assignees to ensure they are accomplished in the allotted time.
Manage the project budget reporting on the project progress along with its expenditures.
Manage the project scope, triggering the change control process whenever necessary and carrying the process through until completion.
Maintain project time frames, budgets, and status reports.
Coordinate meetings among team members including multiple stakeholders having the ability of documenting them in writing so as to follow up on the decisions and action items agreed upon.

What You Will Bring to the Team:
Full-time student pursuing undergraduate degree in one of the following fields or related studies: Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Management.
Excellent facilitation skills with the ability of clearly communicating ideas, tasks, deadlines, and other information related to projects.
Strong sense of urgency to act in a timely manner on the multiple different events of a project.
Good understanding of the Project Management discipline. Some experience participating in a project managed initiative would be a plus.
Superior written and verbal communication skills.
Knowledge of the applications of the MS Office Suite (MS Word, MS Powerpoint, MS Excel and MS Project.
A customer-oriented service attitude and the ability to interact with customers in professional, courteous, and objective manner.

Why You’ll Love Stonebranch:
Competitive compensation

Excellent health benefits
401k to help you save for your future
Regular social events
Paid holidays and generous time off policy to rest and recharge
Convenient North-Atlanta location

Full Job Description
WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

NetherRealm: The creative team that brought Mortal Kombat and Injustice to life is now NetherRealm Studios, part of the Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment family. With over 20 years of creation under our belts, NetherRealm’s mission remains the same; to create cutting edge entertainment and deliver industry leading tech, game art and overall gaming experiences. NetherRealm Studios is a collaborative and creative environment, constantly striving to up the ante on what is possible in interactive entertainment. We encompass the best of both worlds – a team of dedicated professionals with years of experience, who are also at the forefront of an industry taking over the entertainment landscape. The passion and energy that made Mortal Kombat a reality is still on display every day in our offices, our hallways and most definitely the studio’s arcade room! Monolith: For the past 20 years Monolith has been obsessed with delivering a unique gaming experience for our fans. Starting with Blood, our very first title – all the way to our most recent offering, Middle-Earth: Shadow of Mordor, we are constantly pushing the envelope to combine innovative gameplay, inventive narratives, cutting edge tech & AI, and stunning visuals. We are challenging ourselves even further to ensure that our next game is going to be our best yet. That’s where you come in – for us to achieve that we need the best and brightest talent the industry has to offer. Come join us and help create our next AAA title! Turbine: Founded in 1994, Turbine, Inc., a Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment development studio, is focused on creating free-to-play games for mobile platforms. The studio is utilizing its extensive expertise in creating persistent online worlds that foster powerful social gaming communities to develop its mobile titles, which include Batman™: Arkham Underworld and the upcoming Game of Thrones® mobile game. Avalanche: Avalanche Software was acquired by Warner Bros. Interactive Entertainment from Disney in 2016. The studio's first title under WBIE is a companion video game to the upcoming Cars 3, in partnership with Warner Bros., Disney, and Pixar. WB Games SF: Warner Bros. is a top video games publisher across multiple platforms. In mobile games, we have a growing portfolio of hits that includes DC Legends, Mortal Kombat X, and LEGO Star Wars: The Complete Saga, and we continue to expand by adding great people and leveraging the best portfolio of brands and intellectual property in the industry, such as DC Comics, Harry Potter, and LEGO. We are looking to add enthusiastic, talented and experienced professionals to our Mobile Publishing team. WB Games New York: WB Games New York works with some of the top talent in the game industry to build online competitive and social features for video games. Our highly experienced team of engineers utilize cutting-edge technology to build game services that are robust and scalable enough to support world-class developers such as NetherRealm Studios, Rocksteady, Monolith Productions, WB Montréal, and more!

The Job

WB Games Inc. seeks a Data Engineer Intern for the WB Games Boston Data Analytics department.

The WB Games studio is looking for passionate and curious professionals to help level up their data and analytics team. Like us, you love games, and love to have fun. We look for those whose curiosity drives them to try new things, aren’t afraid to fail, and continuously learn.

The Data challenges at WB Games are extensive and you can expect to level up in all data domains. This includes software engineering, cloud-based systems, truly BIG data engineering and analytics.

The Daily

Be part of the game development process, helping teams design and implement analytic-based features.
Learn the internals of building a robust end-to-end data pipeline on all levels especially in databases, data modelling, data processing infrastructure and software development.
Contribute code to production data systems and gain strong software engineering practice.
Gain hands-on experience in distributed data processing technologies: Redshift, Airflow, Presto and Looker.
Learn techniques for high volume distributed data processing and storages.
Ensure the integrity, availability, and confidentiality of data, database systems and supporting services.

The Essentials

You have a drive to learn, ask questions and motivation to find the answers.
You are familiar with one or more of these technologies: Python, PostgreSQL, Go
You are comfortable with DevOps cloud tools (Amazon, EC2, or Google Cloud) and have some working knowledge of monitoring tools
You have side projects or viewable public code on Github, Bitbucket, etc.
You are currently pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical discipline, with an expected graduation date of 2020 or 2021

Bonus Skills

You love games and have checked out our current title
You are well-versed in object-oriented programming (OOP)
You have some experience with Hadoop or other data engineering or database software
You have side projects or viewable public code on Github, Bitbucket, etc.

The Perks

  • Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings
  • Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees
  • Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies
  • Access to in-house learning and development resources
  • Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands

position: College to Corporate IT Internship - Risk & Security
description:
Full Job Description
Bring courage and clarity to risk and security

At Vanguard, we’re changing the way the world invests by always doing the right thing for our clients. That means security is more than a priority; it’s fundamental to our purpose. Protecting our investors from risk requires clear goals, big ideas and resolute action. As part of our College to Corporate Internship Program in the Risk and Security track, you’ll build solutions that keep Vanguard safe day in and day out – protecting twenty million investors from ever-evolving threats by staying one step ahead. Make it count.

In this program you will:
Help to drive security strategy for a people-centric organization
Develop your technical skills and business knowledge
Learn by working side by side with industry authorities on high-profile projects and through coaching with our Risk, HR, and IT leadership teams
Gain exposure to the latest thinking on digital ethics, online security, risk analysis, fraud mitigation, system modification and threat detection
Learn not only the technical components of risk and security, but how to effectively communicate risk and security topics to our business partners

What it takes:
In pursuit of a bachelor's or master's degree with a concentration in computer science, computer engineering, IST, IT, CIS, Security Risk Analysis or related technical/engineering discipline required
Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher preferred
Proven leadership skills
Effective analytical, communication skills

Special Factors

Vanguard is not offering sponsorship for this position

This position will begin in the summer of 2022 and last approximately 10 weeks.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

position: Data Analyst Intern - McKinsey Global Institute (12 months)
description:
Full Job Description
Qualifications
Current student pursuing an undergraduate degree related to economics, computer science, information technology, engineering
Experience/exposure to SQL language, Python, Cloud Environments is a plus
Passion for research and data analytics particularly in economics topics
Proficiency in Excel, Alteryx, Tableau or other ETL related software
Superb people skills and strong team orientation
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Inquisitive and investigative nature with a high degree of creativity and self-motivation
Excellent online research skills; ability to recognize reputable sources and to synthesize information from multiple sources
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Spanish
Who You'll Work With
You'll join our San Jose office as part of our Client Capabilities Network for the McKinsey Global Institute. You will assist in a variety of projects in support of our data platform.
Colleagues in our global Client Capabilities Networkdeliver distinctive client impact through assets and expertise and are driven by a culture of innovation.
McKinsey & Company established the McKinsey Global Institute in 1990 as its independent, internal economics research arm. Its mission is two-fold: to achieve breakthrough microeconomic understanding of the most important global macroeconomic issues today, and to generate insights that materially impact the decisions of both corporate leaders and policymakers.
What You'll Do
You will split your time between content development and knowledge management activities in several long-term research investments.
In content development, you will support the experts in the development of new tools and/or the maintenance of current proprietary databases, especially through database structuring, working on workflow processes and reporting (dashboards). In knowledge management, you will help with the development of supporting documentation, dashboards and newsletters.
The internship will last up to 12 months.

position: 2022 Trading and Portfolio Finance Summer Analyst
description:
Full Job Description
AQR Capital Management

AQR is a global investment firm built at the intersection of financial theory and practical application. We strive to deliver concrete, long-term results by looking past market noise to identify and isolate the factors that matter most, and by developing ideas that stand up to rigorous testing. By putting theory into practice, we have become a leader in alternative strategies and an innovator in traditional portfolio management since 1998.

At AQR, our employees share a common spirit of academic excellence, intellectual honesty and an unwavering commitment to seeking the truth. We're determined to know what makes financial markets tick – and we'll ask every question and challenge every assumption. We recognize and respect the power of collaboration and believe transparency and openness to new ideas leads to innovation.

The Internship Program

Our 10-week summer program puts real work of the firm in your hands. You will work alongside brilliant people, gain insights and know-how from our Quanta Academy Summer Term curriculum, and experience what it's like to work at the pinnacle of global, systematic investing.

Learning is the cornerstone of our culture and plays an active role in the internship experience — through daily collaboration and interaction with employees at all levels, in workshops and classes, and most significantly by working on projects that matter to the many clients we serve. Our unique AQR Quanta Academy: Summer Term learning series, a structured program, consists of over 40 hours of educational, skill-building and networking events.

The Team

The Trading and Financing team is responsible for efficient trade execution of AQR's investment strategies. The team is comprised of traders, trading assistants, trading infrastructure and trading algorithm developers as well as market microstructure and short-term signal researchers. The department:

Is Responsible for all the firm's global trading on exchanges, SEFs and OTC markets

Develops and evaluates algorithmic trading methodologies in many asset classes

Performs transaction cost analysis in markets that the firm transacts in and builds cost forecasting models for use in AQR's investment strategies

Assists Portfolio Implementation and Research Teams in the management of portfolios and the refinement of the investment process

The Portfolio Finance team consists of highly dynamic and multi-faceted professionals with extensive experience at both buy-side and sell-side firms. As one of the most recently formed and actively growing departments at AQR, Portfolio Finance has three primary responsibilities:

Optimizing the traditional and synthetic financing utilization of the firm across all the breath of asset classes traded by the firm, including associated collateral requirements, instrument types (i.e., derivatives or securities), and investment strategies

Investing and portfolio management of domestic and foreign, cash and cash-equivalent instruments

Managing AQR's critical relationships and numerous touchpoints with the largest firms on Wall Street.

Your Role

We are seeking exceptionally talented individuals to join our Trading and Financing team as interns. Candidates should be ambitious and enthusiastic about implementing new ideas, working within the trading desk and with others in the firm to enhance current processes as a self-starter. Interns will experience a 10-week rotational program throughout functions of the team. Interns will fully immerse in the daily functions of high touch and electronic execution trading, portfolio finance, business management and trade support teams. A rotation through some subset of these functions is planned in order to expose the candidate to multiple functions of the team. You will work in a collaborative environment and on an individual capstone project throughout the summer. Mentorship and constructive performance review will be a focus throughout your time as you work towards earning a full-time role.

What You'll Bring

December 2022 or Winter/Spring 2023 graduate in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Business, Engineering, or scientific related field

Well-organized, detail-oriented, and strong verbal and written communication skills

Hard-working and eager to learn in a highly intellectual, collaborative environment

Demonstrated interest in finance, economics, and capital markets

Strong technical/quantitative skills

Computer science/programming skills preferred

AQR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. EEO/VET/DISABILITY

position: College to Corporate IT Internship - Technology Operations
description:
Full Job Description
Build your skills for the future

Do you want to work on new technologies? Are you ready to put your classroom experience into action? Vanguard’s College to Corporate Internship Program is an immersive, hands-on experience at one of the world’s leading investment firms. Extensive training, real-world experience, hands-on opportunities and mentorship from professionals will all aid in broadening your technical expertise in Technology Operations. You’ll receive exposure to a variety of aspects of our enterprise operations and positively impact our clients through challenging assignments like infrastructure operations, network engineering, end user computing, and enterprise architecture. Make it count.

About this program:
The program is a full-time, paid summer internship available in Charlotte, NC.
You’ll receive exposure to a variety of aspects of the software life cycle and positively impact our clients through one of these challenging assignments:
Networking services and Telecommunications
Supporting Unix & Linux or Windows platforms
Capacity planning
Performance analysis
Supporting video and voice technologies

In this program, you will

Create high-impact solutions that allow crew to perform at their best and do what’s right for investors
Gain hands-on experience that will aid in broadening your technical expertise in technology operations
Share your insights and make your voice heard in a collaborative and supportive environment
Receive an opportunity to build a network with program managers, alumni, senior leaders and other interns
Participate in developmental activities such as one-on-one feedback sessions, Tips for Success, and Industry Discussions

As an intern, you will build skills using some of the latest technology

Databases: DB2, Oracle, SQL Server
Platforms/Servers: zOS, Solaris, Windows, Linux, Web and Application.NET, Spring, Web Services, Web, Mobile apps (iOS, Android)
Languages/Tools: Java, JSF, Ajax, JavaScript, C/C++/C#, XML, XSLT, HTML, XHTML, CSS, Cobol, Maven, Hudson, Subversion, Nexus, JTest, Sharepoint, AngularJS, Selenium
Concepts: Distributed systems, Tiered development, Data Driven decision making. Service Oriented Architecture, responsive design, Automated Testing

What it takes

In pursuit of a bachelor's or master's degree with a concentration in computer science, computer engineering, IST, IT, CIS, Security Risk Analysis or related technical/engineering discipline required
Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher preferred
Proven leadership skills
Effective analytical, communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a dynamic environment

Special Factors

Vanguard is not offering sponsorship for this position

This position will begin in the summer of 2022 and last approximately 10 weeks.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

All applicants must complete the work experience and education sections and attach any required documents. Applications must describe all relevant work experience in detail, beginning with your current or most recent job, including military service (indicate rank), internships and job-related volunteer work, if applicable. Only applicants that follow the application instructions and submit completed applications will be considered.The New Jersey Judiciary consists of: the Supreme Court, the Superior Court including the Appellate Division and the Trial Court of the 15 vicinages in New Jersey, the Tax Court and the Municipal Court System. The Administrative Office of the Courts provides technical assistance, operational support, training, research and development, budget and personnel coordination, and development and operation of information systems for the Courts of New Jersey. Full Job Description
Company Description

Square builds common business tools in unconventional ways so more people can start, run, and grow their businesses. When Square started, it was difficult and expensive (or just plain impossible) for some businesses to take credit cards. Square made credit card payments possible for all by turning a mobile phone into a credit card reader. Since then Square has been building an entire business toolkit of both hardware and software products including Square Capital, Square Terminal, Square Payroll, and more. We’re working to find new and better ways to help businesses succeed on their own terms—and we’re looking for people like you to help shape tomorrow at Square.

Job Description

Square's Hardware Team builds the tangible connection to Square. We started with a simple Reader that turns any phone or tablet into a mobile point of sale - and we continue to lead this category with advances in technologies that define point of sale hardware (NFC, display, WiFi, Bluetooth, touch). Our hardware engineers design and develop outstanding hardware products. They understand the subtleties of user interaction, robust communication interfaces, and smart product design.

For this 12-week remote internship, you will:
Become intimately familiar with Square's hardware products and manufacturing processes.
Research technologies for our next-generation hardware products.
As part of the Systems Engineering track, you will develop device characterization plans and measurement-setup prototypes for new technologies.
As part of the Electrical Design Engineering track, you will help design and test electrical systems for new Square hardware products
Work with Square's Devices Software Engineering group to understand embedded test access and APIs.
Write and debug engineering automation software for the lab and the factory.
Reach beyond boundaries to make Square's products better wherever you see the chance

Qualifications

You are:
Pursuing a degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field, graduating between May 2022 and June 2024.
Familiar with Python, MATLAB, or similar programming language
Experience with EE schematics and PCB layout

Experience measurement systems automation.
Knowledgeable of statistics
Familiar with the co-existence of multiple technologies in a unified system.
Experience with Altium Schematic and PCB design tools

Full Job Description
Overview:
NV5 (NASDAQ: NVEE) is a provider of engineering and consulting services to public and private sector clients, delivering solutions through six business verticals: Testing, Inspection & Consulting; Infrastructure; Utility Services; Environmental Health Sciences; Buildings & Program Management; and Geospatial Technology. With offices nationwide and abroad, NV5 helps clients plan, design, build, test, certify, and operate projects that improve the communities where we live and work.

As engineers, architects, construction/program managers, environmental professionals and beyond, we play a significant role in shaping our communities through the services we provide. We are looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team focused on Delivering Solutions and Improving Lives.

Job Summary:
The Software Developer Intern will contribute to the company by working closely with internal employees to improve, extend, and debug existing internal applications. The intern will work directly with the IT Manager to learn about the software development lifecycle, from coding to testing to deployment.

Responsibilities:
Develop and debug internal applications in C#, VB.NET, and SQL.
Provide end-user support for internal applications.

Qualifications:
Ideally a junior or senior pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Some experience with C#, VB.NET, and SQL Server.
Some experience working in Visual Studio 2019.
Exposure to AWS and Microsoft Azure a plus.

NV5 offers a competitive compensation and benefits package including medical, dental, life insurance, PTO, 401(k) and professional development/advancement opportunities.

NV5 provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, creed, citizenship status, ancestry, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. NV5 complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

description:
Full Job Description

< WORK REMOTELY DUE TO COVID-19 >>

Division: JacPac - Social Impact Team

Highly self-motivated, detailed-orientated, passion-driven undergraduate and graduate students need only to apply. We are seeking college students in the field of digital media, visual arts, or related fields to assist us in our #100 jobs campaign to help disabled, homeless, disenfranchised clients obtain employment.

The purpose of the position is to be a part of the Social Impact (Client Training) team and complete daily tasks and assignments under the supervision of the campaign lead and/or field supervisor.

This internship will provide an educational experience for Digital Media interns to assist our clients to train for employment with our strategic partner. The major goal of this social impact partnership is to increase the number of disabled working graduates available for future jobs within this organization. Our purpose is to create an atmosphere in which the student is free to explore and learn while focusing on skill development, time management, and practicing methods and models required to perform specific assignments.

Our campaign strategy is to find the right interns that understand and respects our mission to advocate, support, and motivate our clients to meet their career goals and obtain gainful employment.

What you'll do:

  • Organize and string together raw footage into a continuous whole according to scripts or the instructions of the campaign manager.
  • Remain positive and professional and work with the fashion team to attract the younger generation and college student community.
  • Engage viewers and clients with our products and service
  • Select and combine the most effective shots of each scene to form a logical and smoothly running story.
  • Edit films and videotapes to insert music, dialogue, and sound effects, arrange films into sequences, and correct errors, using editing equipment.

What you'll need:

  • Currently enrolled college students
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task

§ Must be an enrolled undergrad or graduate student.

§ Must be organized and detail-oriented.

Full Job Description

Internship Summer/Fall 2021 - Game Artist, 3D Modeler

Begin: June 23rd

This is for internship Only.

***All applicants are REQUIRED to submit a link to any playable games or videos of games that you have worked on. No Exceptions

Note: This internship is NOT for beginner level Game Artist. Your skill set will need to be intermediate or higher.

Previous Simulation Game Artist/Designer/Programmer internship is preferred.

---------------------------------------------------

Who We Are:

Alexis Day Agency is a boutique Brand Design and Graphic Design agency based in Los Angeles seeking a highly creative, visually innovative and forward-thinking Game Artist - Environment Modeler, 2D, 3D Modeler intern. In this internship role, you will help create concepts and assets for a simulated atmosphere for a high-end brands project. Ideal candidate loves designing virtual simulated atmospheres. We are looking for an innovative artist with a unique, clean and realistic design style, and who loves a challenge and to be different.

ATTENTION: This internship is not for beginner designers. You must be at an intermediate level or higher to work with our high achiever intern team. You will be working on a new and very unique project that requires Game Artist, Game Designer, Programmer, modeling, texturing, rendering, and animation experience. This project will add an uncommon piece of work for your portfolio that no one else will have in the competitive gaming marketplace.

On a day-to-day basis you will get to do the following:

Responsibilities

  • Provide concepts and storyboards for in-development game mechanics and features.
  • Participate in the look/feel, development, and conceptual process for new game like ideas
  • Participate in the full art cycle from pre-production to post-production
  • Build and create game assets up to the high standards required by the end user.
  • Participate in visual critiques and brainstorms.

Requirements

  • 2+ years of experience as a game artist
  • 2 years of game atmosphere development
  • 2 years of 2D, 3D Modeling
  • 2 years of texturing
  • 2 years of Realistic game design aesthetic
  • Experience in development, animating and producing production art for mobile game-like simulation atmospheres, and marketing material.
  • Attention to detail
  • Sense of urgency and a desire to get things done.
  • Must have your own computer with access to the latest design software.
  • Able to work remotely very dependable, reliable and maturely.
  • Ability to work within deadlines.
  • Take direction and constructive critiquing well
  • Self-starter, take initiative, require minimal supervision
  • Work well in a creative team environment
  • Have a no task too small attitude

Benefits

  • Work directly with company CEO, as well as work on your own remotely.
  • Brainstorming with other artist, designer and marketing interns as needed.
  • An opportunity to have your work seen in over 70 countries and showcased through an award-winning luxury lifestyle publication, read by affluent end users.

The opportunity to be recognized in the award-winning luxury lifestyle publication The Contour of Luxury™. View publication here: www.contourofluxury.com.

Education:

College Senior, College Grad or Grad Student with a 3.5 GPA or higher ONLY.

Must have or are completing an Associates degree or higher in Gaming, Computer Science, or related field.

Compensation:

College Credit, unpaid internship

**Commission Payment offered on applicable paid projects that are approved and completed.

Our design projects help build competitive portfolios.

------------------------------------------------

What our interns have said: http://www.alexisdayagency.com/whatourinternssay/

------------------------------------------------

Must be able to intern a minimum of 20 hours 3-5 days a week with a 4 months commitment.

Internship Work Schedule:

You will create your schedule to accommodate your work and/or school class schedule

*Internship schedule must be the same every week.

position: Software Intern- Factory and Automation Controls (Fall 2021)
description:
Full Job Description
at Rivian Automotive
United States, Illinois, Normal

Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.

We operate development centers in Plymouth, Michigan; Southern California (Irvine, Carson & LA); Silicon Valley (San Jose and Palo Alto); Vancouver, British Columbia; and Surrey, England; as well as a manufacturing facility in Normal, Illinois.

Disclaimer: Applying to this requisition will place you into consideration for an internship on our Manufacturing Engineering team. Exact Team Allocation will be discussed during the hiring process.

Internship Term: Fall 2021
Rivian internships are experiences optimized for student candidates. To be eligible, you must be an undergraduate or graduate student in an accredited program during the internship term. If you are not pursuing a degree, please see our full time positions at Rivian.com/careers

Note that if your university has specific requirements for internship programs, it is your responsibility to fulfill those requirements.

Role Responsibilities:
Support what automation solutions in the manufacturing industries can be while automating the process of designing, developing, and deploying new production lines.
Create tools for auto-generating automation controls for manufacturing equipment including:
Electrical schematics
PLC code
Robot code
Human Machine Interfaces (HMI)
Create tools that allow for agile software development for automation controls including:
Auto-backups
Unit testing
Static Analysis
Deployment
Support the development of software for use in a Manufacturing Execution System (MES) for part quality, genealogy, and process control
Participate in the design and development of in-house software to use as a user-interface for controlling and troubleshooting automation equipment
Use modern software tools and practices to ensure high performance, low latency, and ease of deployment.

Qualifications:
Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science or Equivalent
Strong Plus: experience with programming HTML5, React, Go, Python, and similar
Knowledge of continuous integration & continuous deployment (CICD) pipeline tools such as Jenkins
Knowledge of or experience working on applications for the manufacturing industry
Willingness to work in a high volume, fast paced environment
Adaptability supporting ambitious goals and timelines

Equal Opportunity

Rivian is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information or characteristics, physical or mental disability, marital/domestic partner status, age, military/veteran status, medical condition, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Rivian is committed to ensuring that our hiring process is accessible for persons with disabilities. If you have a disability or limitation, such as those covered by the Americans with Disabilities Act, that requires accommodations to assist you in the search and application process, please email us at accessibility@rivian.com.

Privacy

We take your privacy seriously. For details please see our Candidate Privacy Notice.

Full Job Description
Are you ready to join a growing team that puts a premium on productivity and has an award-winning culture, centered around transforming talented employees into effective business leaders?

Then Bankers Healthcare Group is the place for you. We offer innovative financial solutions to licensed and highly-skilled professionals, representing the best of both traditional lending and fintech, and are looking for passionate, impact players to help take our company to the next level.

At BHG, you’ll become immersed in the finance industry—with a variety of loan solutions, credit cards, patient financing, bank programs, and collections services, which have helped BHG become one of the leading providers of finance solutions.

With over 19 years in business, we have the stability of an established company with the speed and agility of a startup, where ingenuity and risk-taking are encouraged, and every employee has the opportunity to learn, grow and thrive.

You are a student or recent grad who has a passion for collaboration. You are an analytical thinker that has a strong customer focus. You are accountable for researching, analyzing, and documenting clear and actionable business requirements so that information can distribute them across one or more development teams to deliver the desired functionality incrementally.
What You'll Do
Assists with the definition and direction of complex features and enhancements
Defines and documents stories and conditions of acceptance with other stakeholders' input including Developers and QA
Utilizes exceptional communication skills and collaborates well with onshore and offshore resources
Validates proposed value with customers and prospects using research, prototypes, and designs
Identifies cross-team dependencies when leading a feature through the development process
Helps ensure customers and the organization is ready for new product releases by providing learning content and material and participating in knowledge transfer events as needed
Helps drive features through the development process by working with engineering, prioritizing functional requirements, making appropriate scope tradeoffs, and ensuring completed capability satisfies customers’ needs in a timely manner
Learns customer needs by participating in customer & internal stakeholder meetings
Assists member's services and engineering troubleshooting product escalations
Identifies and proposes process changes including a plan and success measures
What You'll Need
Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or related technical discipline
Strong analytical skills to understand business requirements and then break them down into more granular level requirements
Effective communication skills: ability to communicate complex concepts to stakeholders
Self-motivated and willing to do what it takes to get the job done
Positive team player attitude with excellent verbal and written communication skills
High degree of organizational skills
Life at BHG
At BHG, we work hard and aren’t afraid to take risks. Since the beginning, our core values of PMA (positive mental attitude), team player and loyalty have been the driving force behind every interaction we have between each other and our customers. We have a healthy respect for the daily grind, yet we value work/life balance. We believe that all employees should have the opportunity to lead and that good ideas can come from anyone. From the top-down, our leaders are actively involved not only in strategic oversight and running the business, but also in the wellbeing and growth of all employees. We consider people our #1 asset, and help employees realize their full potential, set and exceed their goals, and explore new opportunities for personal and professional development.

Why You Should Join BHG
We strive to offer amenities, opportunities, events, and programming that support the interests of our teams, while furthering the culture that makes us Great Place to Work® certified. Some of the benefits you can expect when you join BHG include:

  • 100% coverage of monthly health insurance premiums
  • Competitive PTO and vacation policies
  • Company 401(k) plan with employer contributions after one year
  • On-site gym access and memberships, with personal trainers, and certified nutritionists on staff
  • Company-sponsored training and certification opportunities
  • Monthly award ceremonies where top achievers are celebrated and receive additional bonuses
  • Ongoing volunteer opportunities to give back to the community through our BHG Cares program
If you’re ready for a career where you can exercise your passions, be surrounded by co-workers who are relentlessly committed to service, and have a team-player mindset, apply today!

** All Remote employee's at Bankers Healthcare Group are required to work within the United States of America.

Bankers Healthcare Group is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. Bankers Healthcare Group is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

At the Alliance Innovation Lab – Silicon Valley (AIL–SV), we bring artificial intelligence (AI) to mobility. From developing autonomous driving systems to designing life on board experiences, our researchers apply AI technology to improve mobility for everybody. We are exploring the cutting edge of artificial intelligence and robotics, including sensing, perception, mapping, prediction, planning, decision making, and control, to lay the groundwork for the future of mobility.

Think you’ve got the internal drive to support the production of great vehicles and join a winning team? Welcome to an open lane of possibility. Apply for this position and start the process to kick your career into high gear.

We know you have the capability to change the world, and we want you to help us change the future of automotive.

Full Job Description
IPP is a global organization within NVIDIA. This group works with various other groups within NVIDIA Software such as Graphics Processors, Mobile Processors, Deep Learning, Artificial Intelligence and Driveless Cars to cater to their infrastructure needs. These cloud services provide almost half a million automated jobs per day on thousands of servers helping with the efficiency of thousands of NVIDIA's software engineers worldwide. The cloud hosts heterogeneous mix of machines and devices with various operating systems (Windows/Linux/Android), multitude of hardware platforms both NVIDIA GPUs and Tegra Processors. We’re looking for someone who can thrive in a fast moving environment and love being challenged to learn new things. You’ll come in with a basic understanding of engineering and operational principles and leave with a head filled to bursting with tools, processes, practices, and technology solutions.

What you'll be doing:
Developing and improving cloud automation, reporting, and monitoring

Proactively contribute to documentation, automation, and processes as they evolve

Learn about building and operating services at scale in a fast-iteration setup

Own small projects supporting internal process engineering efforts

Develop a working understanding of some of the common tools and practices used for microservice development and infrastructure

Work on fast paced DevOps engineering team

What we need to see:
Currently enrolled in a graduate program in Computer Science or related subject area. Completed undergraduate degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering is requirement

Strong object-oriented programming background, Java, Python preferred.

Familiarity with Container management solutions (Docker, Kubernetes)

Background with CI/CD tools (Jenkins etc.) & practice , source code management systems ex: Git , GitLab etc.

Familiarity with Relational Databases such as MySQL, NoSQL DBs such as Elastic Search, MongoDB, HBase

Ability to turn design, compliance, and support references/content into documentation, presentations, and training

Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Background with Windows, Linux operating systems as well as network technologies

Some familiarity with AWS or other cloud computing platforms

Ability to analyze situations and utilize troubleshooting skills, systems and tools, and problem solving abilities

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us. If you're creative and passionate about developing cloud services we want to hear from you!

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

CIS (Center for Internet Security) is the trusted guide to confidence in the connected world. CIS collaborates with the global security community to lead both government and private-sector entities to security solutions and resources. CIS is an independent, not-for-profit organization.

position: Intern - Planning and Zoning - Baldwin County Commission
description:
Full Job Description
Position Description

The Baldwin County Commission (subsequently referred to as “the County”) is seeking a temporary Planning intern. This internship will be for a graduate or undergraduate student studying Community or Urban Planning, Computer Science, Information Technology, Public Administration, Engineering, Geography, or a related field.

Job Description:
The primary function of the intern is to provide administrative and customer service functions to support the Planning and Zoning Department. The intern will be responsible for providing customer service, researching and updating data, and performing basic zoning/subdivision research for the department.

Essential Job Functions

Responds to inquiries and provides assistance to County staff and the public, by telephone, email and in person, regarding zoning and related planning information;
Assists planners and planning techs with reviewing plans for compliance with zoning/subdivision standards;
Assists planners with planning/subdivision related research;
Maintains and updates information in Citizenserve;
Participating in and/or managing special planning projects under the supervision of Planners
Assists in the preparation of address mailing lists for planning applications;
Creates, updates, and maintains spreadsheets, reports, and databases from established content; verifies and tabulates data; run basic reports and queries as requested;
Data collection and field assessments
Creates and maintains records, related correspondence and documents;
Performs a variety of clerical and administrative support tasks for the Department;
Performs all work duties and activities in accordance with County’s policies and procedures

Education and Experience

Computer programs; Word, Excel, PowerPoint. Preference given for applicants with background in GIS.
General office procedures; answering phones, copying, filing. Be able to follow direction as well as take self-initiative, must be courteous, polite and enjoy meeting and talking with people both in-person and on the phone.
Preference for a graduate or undergraduate student studying Community or Urban Planning, Computer Science, Information Technology, Public Administration, Engineering, Geography, or a related field.

Full Job Description
Stonebranch builds dynamic IT automation solutions that transform business IT environments from simple IT task automation into sophisticated, real-time business service automation, helping organizations achieve the highest possible Return on Automation. No matter the degree of automation, Stonebranch software is simple, modern and secure. Using its universal automation platform, enterprises can seamlessly orchestrate workloads and data across technology ecosystems and silos. Headquartered in Alpharetta, Georgia with points of contact and support throughout the Americas, Europe, and Asia, Stonebranch serves some of the world's largest financial, manufacturing, healthcare, travel, transportation, energy, and technology institutions.

Your Part in this Growth Story:
Stonebranch is searching for a Solution Engineer Intern who’s interested in playing in the explosive IT automation market. As a Solution Engineer intern, you will contribute your knowledge and ideas in helping our Professional Services team on implementation projects of Stonebranch’s Universal Automation Center (UAC) family of products.

You will work under the guidance of a more senior engineer or team lead. Preference given to juniors, seniors, and recent graduates. This is a temporary role with potential to grow into a permanent position.

Your Impact on The Organization:
Participate in requirements sessions with the client to determine specific needs for product configuration.
Understand and participate in all the phases of Stonebranch’s UAC implementation including architectural analysis and design, deployment, conversion (from another existing software), development, optimization, and training.
Understand Stonebranch’s conversion methodology and support the client and other team members using it during a project implementation.
Understand the technical aspects of the conversion methodology and be ready to address issues and difficulties that may come up during the implementation process.
Take ownership tasks assigned to you and carry them out to completion in a timely manner.
Embrace Project Management and technical software implementation and configuration best practices.

What You Will Bring to the Team:
Full-time student pursuing undergraduate degree in one of the following fields or related studies: Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Management.
Creative problem solving and critical thinking skills.
Superior written and verbal communication skills.
The desire and attitude to learn from Senior Engineers and work well in a collaborative environment.
Must be 18 years of age or older.

Knowledge of the following concepts and technologies:
One of the following programming languages: Java, Python, C and C++
High level knowledge of the Unix and Windows operating systems
Project Management concepts.
Basic understanding of SQL, HTML/Java Script and shell scripting.
Cloud architecture and concepts.
Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.

Why You’ll Love Stonebranch:
Competitive compensation
Workforce fitness program / gym reimbursement
Excellent health benefits
401k to help you save for your future
Regular social events
Paid holidays and generous time off policy to rest and recharge
Convenient North-Atlanta location

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:
Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

As part of the Global Partner Engineering team, you will be working on various research projects including technical and market view on SAP’s multiple product lines.

What you’ll do:
Position Title: SAP iXp Intern - Research Executive
Location: Virtual USA
Expected Start Date: June 2021
Contract Duration: 6 to 12 months

In this role, you’ll:
As an intern, your tasks may include:
Market research of ISVs (Independent Software vendors), VAR (Value added resellers) and SI (System Integrators)
Online research and analysis as required for the project
Technology research
Research on various Industry

Who you are:
We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

Pursuing a bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science or Advertising and Marketing or Law or related fields
Ability to absorb new concepts and apply them for the tasks
Inclination to work in the Software/IT industry.
Moderate to expert knowledge of Microsoft productivity tools such as PowerPoint and Excel
Strong work ethic

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.
A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team. position: College to Corporate Internship - Investment Management - PA
description:
Full Job Description
Drive superior investment results

Why join Vanguard’s College to Corporate Internship Program for Investment Management? You will experience buy-side investing with a leading-edge investment management organization. Your internship will provide an opportunity to collaborate alongside a team of premier investment professionals and influence the investment outcomes of over thirty million clients. Through hands-on involvement with the global investment ecosystem and equipped with the tools and resources to succeed, you’ll learn how these elements shape the financial future of our clients and of Vanguard itself. Make it count!

In this internship program:
Pursue an assignment within one of Vanguard's investment teams including Fixed Income Group (FIG), Equity Index Group (EIG), Quantitative Equity Group (QEG), Investment Strategy Group (ISG), Portfolio Review Department (PRD), Investment Management FinTech Strategies (IMFS), or Risk Management Group (RMG). You will work in a department that draws upon your experiences and interests as well as meets our business needs
Experience an intensive, comprehensive approach to investing that employs a range of strategies across asset classes, expanding your expertise while developing a broad understanding of our business
Smaller cadre sizes which support opportunities for focused learning, individualized feedback, and close community connections
Collaborate with others and lead a project distilling complex data to uncover insights that you will present to leadership – influencing decisions that directly affect investors
Meet regularly with your department manager, internship program manager, and key business leaders. Receive personalized coaching and mentorship
Cultivate new relationships in a stimulating network of dedicated professionals working to do what’s right for the investor
Make a positive impact on investors and the global financial markets as a whole through your increased knowledge of Vanguard’s mission driven investment philosophy

Lead the future of investing
At Vanguard, we value community, camaraderie, and leaders who are adaptable and independent-minded. Your upbeat work ethic, leadership and communication abilities will be invaluable as we advance our mission to make investment success accessible to everyone. Strong analytical skills, problem-solving abilities, and conceptual creativity will help further your expertise in investments and products in a dynamic internship program, preparing for a career in investment management. Here, you’ll make your internship count as you advance Vanguard’s mission.
Upon successful completion of the program, you will have the opportunity to apply for a full-time position, including one of the Vanguard rotational programs. These opportunities are designed to provide a broad work-training experience prior to launching into your specific role.

What it takes
Cumulative GPA of 3.5 or higher preferred.
Majors in Finance, Economics, Statistics, Math, Accounting, Engineering, or Computer Science preferred
Effective communication, analytical, leadership, and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Adaptability, the ability to learn quickly, and take initiative
Passion for Investment Management
Results-oriented with the ability to lead multiple priorities
Strong technical acumen a plus, including data analytical, statistical, and programming (preferably Python) skills
A commitment to strengthening communities by donating your time and talent

Special Factors
At this time Vanguard is only considering candidates that will not now, or in the future, need sponsorship or other immigration support to obtain US work authorization
This program is a full-time, paid summer internship
The start date for this program will be May/June 2022
Acceptance into the program is contingent upon a successful drug-screening result

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

position: Intern - Planning and Zoning - Baldwin County Commission
description:
Full Job Description
JOB
The Baldwin County Commission (subsequently referred to as “the County”) is seeking a temporary Planning intern. This internship will be for a graduate or undergraduate student studying Community or Urban Planning, Computer Science, Information Technology, Public Administration, Engineering, Geography, or a related field. Job Description: The primary function of the intern is to provide administrative and customer service functions to support the Planning and Zoning Department. The intern will be responsible for providing customer service, researching and updating data, and performing basic zoning/subdivision research for the department.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Responds to inquiries and provides assistance to County staff and the public, by telephone, email and in person, regarding zoning and related planning information;Assists planners and planning techs with reviewing plans for compliance with zoning/subdivision standards;Assists planners with planning/subdivision related research;Maintains and updates information in Citizenserve;Participating in and/or managing special planning projects under the supervision of PlannersAssists in the preparation of address mailing lists for planning applications;Creates, updates, and maintains spreadsheets, reports, and databases from established content; verifies and tabulates data; run basic reports and queries as requested;Data collection and field assessmentsCreates and maintains records, related correspondence and documents;Performs a variety of clerical and administrative support tasks for the Department;Performs all work duties and activities in accordance with County’s policies and procedures

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Computer programs; Word, Excel, PowerPoint. Preference given for applicants with background in GIS. General office procedures; answering phones, copying, filing. Be able to follow direction as well as take self-initiative, must be courteous, polite and enjoy meeting and talking with people both in-person and on the phone. Preference for a graduate or undergraduate student studying Community or Urban Planning, Computer Science, Information Technology, Public Administration, Engineering, Geography, or a related field.

Company Description: Maximal is an engineering design firm based out of mHub, the largest hardtech incubator in America. The company works in a highly collaborative, interdisciplinary, and cross-functional environment working with engineers and designers of all backgrounds to stand up the most innovative solutions in the shortest time and the most efficient use of resources. Our work spans across industries including automotive, additive and subtractive manufacturing, consumer, industrial, IoT, mobile, wearables and more. Maximal designs systems and key components for Fortune 500 companies and other industry leaders to enable workflow optimizations, higher quality production, lower incident rates, and a smile on the customers face. The Company supports product teams within large and small companies to bring their products to market, optimize existing designs, and plan product market strategy. Overview:
NV5 (NASDAQ: NVEE) is a provider of engineering and consulting services to public and private sector clients, delivering solutions through six business verticals: Testing, Inspection & Consulting; Infrastructure; Utility Services; Environmental Health Sciences; Buildings & Program Management; and Geospatial Technology. With offices nationwide and abroad, NV5 helps clients plan, design, build, test, certify, and operate projects that improve the communities where we live and work.

As engineers, architects, construction/program managers, environmental professionals and beyond, we play a significant role in shaping our communities through the services we provide. Position Summary

The Internship Program at HealthStream will enable you to grow personally and professionally by providing you with real-world experience in one of the top healthcare IT companies in the United States. In HealthStream’s Internship Program, you will have the opportunity to work on a variety of projects in a stimulating, collaborative environment. This experience, in partnership with your coursework, will set you up on a road for career success.

In this position you will work in a software development team to help develop serverless software in the cloud as part of Healthstream's hStream initiative.

The team built and now uses & maintains an in-house cloud based tool for developing serverless software on AWS. You'll be helping to build a new release of this tool.

In this internship you'll get experience working on a serverless Python-based back end system using AWS Lambda and a React-based web front end (Javascript) on AWS, using cutting edge technologies and techniques.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES OR RESPONSIBILITIES – (The below listed duties are not all inclusive. This position must also perform other duties as assigned.):

  • Develop software
  • Write documentation
  • Use source control systems
  • Work effectively both on your own and in a team environment
Job Specifications

1. KNOWLEDGE/EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
A degree in computer science (can be underway) or equivalent or similar.
Adjacent specializations will definitely be considered (eg: data science, or other sciences) but bear in mind that this position will primarily involve coding.
Any other course of study will be considered if you can make the case.
All intern candidates MUST be currently enrolled students in an accredited college or university
Transcripts may be requested at any point during the interviewing process (unofficial transcripts acceptable).

2. SKILLS REQUIRED (manual, verbal or mental manipulation of data or things):

Some solid exposure to and experience computer programming
Preferably coursework heavily involving programming
Python and/or Javascript skills highly desirable

3. ABILITIES REQUIRED (work characteristics, behaviors, leadership abilities, etc.):

Grit: the ability to keep going when the work is hard / confusing
Ability to work with others.
Creativity and Curiosity
A passion for computers and software
Must be a full-time student at an accredited university
Upperclassmen (Juniors and Seniors) as well as graduate-level students will be considered
Interns are expected to work 20 hours a week for the September-December internship period. Internship will cover dates starting in September and ending in December, with some flexibility on dates given varying school schedules.
This is a paid internship; pay starts at $12/hr for the Internship Program

Every organization needs a website - but the process of working with an agency or freelancers is often a huge pain. Late deliverables, inadequate communication, and poor quality of work plague the industry in a serious way.

This internship is designed to teach a great designer how to be a great website developer! We'll teach you everything that you need to know to utilize your eye for design to create fantastic websites for clients.

*
The goal for this internship is to train you to be eligible for a full-time position on our team.

*

*

*
