Full Job Description
DEPARTMENT: DPW Engineering

HOURS WORKED: Mon-Fri (8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.), 40 hours/week

STARTING SALARY: Hourly wage $15.00 - $17.00/hour

PRIMARY DUTIES
The Engineering Department of the Public Works Division is seeking to hire a Civil or Environmental Engineering student to assist the staff in Public Works improvement projects and work associated with the daily functions of the department. Tasks may include, but are not limited to, surveying, AutoCAD drafting, research, design, calculations, field investigations and documentation especially related to the drainage and wastewater systems, utilizing ArcMap GIS Software to assist in: updating spatial databases, reading and interpreting site plans or record drawing documents and updating attribute information, and participating in a team environment to perform data collection using Global Positioning System equipment.

QUALIFICATIONS
Must be full time student pursuing a BS degree in GIS, Civil/Environmental Engineering, Community & Regional Planning, Computer Science, Geography or related field or equivalent experience. Must have experience with AutoCAD, Microsoft Word, Power Point and Excel and be at least 18 years of age and possess a valid driver’s license with a good driving record.

APPLICATION PROCEDURE
Submit cover letter, application, resume, and three professional references at:
http://applitrack.com/nashua/onlineapp/

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER - Recruiting practices shall be consistent with State and Federal Law (5/18/2021)

Full Job Description
Summary

As part of the Information technology (IT) team, the Help Desk Technician provides support and troubleshooting for the Agency's Information Technology Solutions at all Program service sites. This position directly interfaces with end-users in a support capacity and requires travel within Onondaga County. As required, this position addresses support service, preventative maintenance and repair issues related to, internet connections, workstations, laptops, peripherals, printers and other hardware / software. The Help Desk Technician reports to the IT Manager under the oversight of the Chief Information Officer.

Requirements

End User Support

1

Computer and office technology expertise that is required to fulfill job responsibilities and assignments.

2

Configure and deploy end user technologies (PCs, Mobile devices, Printers)

3

Provide staff user orientation and training related to computer and mobile usage.

4

Primary responsibility for monitoring the help desk system and responding to work orders.

5

Provide diagnostic and end-user support services for all locations.

6

Ability to diagnose and repair computer hardware.

7

Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot computer software.

8

Provides other job-related support and services as required or assigned by the IT Manager and other Agency management.

Professional Development

9

Works with IT Management to develop skills in IT troubleshooting including developing and understanding of networks, domain and account management and IT security.

10

Maintain and/or achieve job-required certifications and/or licenses.

General Agency Responsibilities

11

Work within a team-oriented environment supporting computer software and hardware.

12

Supports the Goals and Mission of Arc of Onondaga. Ensures that communications and personal performance reflect the Agency's commitment to teamwork, compliance with policies and procedures and respect for consumers and staff.

13

Expected to conduct all agency business and complete job responsibilities in accordance with agency Code of Conduct and Corporate Compliance Plan.

14

Establishes and provides clear and legible documentation and compliance records required by Arc and other government agencies.

15

Own or lease a vehicle and possess ability to transport self to suppliers, vendors and multi-site locations.

Note Requirements 1 - 8 are Essential Job Requirements

Education, Experience, and Technology Requirements
Either in process of obtaining a 2 or 4 year degree in information technology, or with an equivalent amount of experience in computer hardware and software troubleshooting.
One or more years of experience in computer software and hardware.
Experience supporting end users (desktop and mobile) technologies Windows 10, MS Office, Multi-function devices, Android devices, internet and WIFI connectivity.
Nice to have - Understand and have working knowledge of
Office 365, particularly Exchange 365.
Help desk technician experience.
Networking technologies including VPN and WIFI.
Combination of education and experience which, in the judgement of the employer, equals above standards.
A valid NYS driver's license and a driving record acceptable to the Agency's insurance carrier.

Instruction & Safety

The job requires specific levels of responsibility for the safety of the incumbent and people he/she interacts with on a daily basis. Safety requirements and decisions reflect agency or legal requirements that are above and beyond generally accepted practices and procedures for personal safety and/or servicing individuals and staff.

Physical Demands & Working Conditions

Work requires routine physical exertion equivalent to lifting between 25 and 50 pounds, for approximately 20% of their workday, while assisting individuals, moving materials and/or operating equipment. Incumbents have moderate exposure to undesirable or adverse environmental conditions. Position requirements for physical stamina, endurance, and physical manipulation is significant. Accountabilities require sustained amounts of time sitting, walking and/or standing. The use of safety equipment and/or specific precautions is required.

Flexible availability to meet agency emergency needs or planned installations, upgrades, etc. outside of normal working hours.

Responsibility for Resources

The job requires an extremely high responsibility for resources. Examples of resources include costly specialized computer and technology equipment, supplies and significant assets. The staff member has direct control over these resources. Problems and decisions associated with these resources may be complex and can impact an operating unit, department and the agency

Supervisory Responsibilities

None

position: Emerging Talent Intern 2021-2022, Mechanical Software Development - 7514
description:
Full Job Description
Ansys is the global leader in engineering simulation, helping the world's most innovative companies deliver radically better products to their customers. By offering the best and broadest portfolio of engineering simulation software, Ansys helps companies solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination.

The goal of the Ansys Emerging Talent program is to provide experiential learning, structured job experiences, and a platform to help talented students launch their career with Ansys. The Emerging Talent program will allow students the opportunity to refine technical knowledge, enhance personal talents, and encourage collaboration and networking in our areas of focus with the ultimate goal of converting our Emerging Talent interns into full-time Ansys employees at the completion of the program. Entry into the Emerging Talent Program is through a paid 40-hour per week internship, for 14-16 weeks per rotation, and requires a 1-2 rotation commitment from a student beginning in Fall 2021.

As an Emerging Talent Intern, you will be provided with continuous role-based skills training and development as well as formal assessment and evaluations. You will have a dedicated mentor and receive regular coaching. You will also participate in University Relations activities (networking) and learning series opportunities.

The Emerging Talent Intern will be part of the AnsysMechanical development team and will work together with the team todevelopadvanced engineering features in Mechanical flagship product.The Intern will get an opportunity toexperience how software development is done to solveengineeringproblemsin an intuitive and integrated Mechanical environment and willcontributetoadvanceengineering features like fracture mechanics, linear dynamics, coupled field analysisetc.The Intern will also get toexperienceofhow softwaredesignprinciples apply in an engineering discipline to simulate physicsfornext generation products.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Research, design and implement features in a state-of-the-art Computer Aided Engineering (CAE) software application based on the Finite Element Analysis (FEA).

Develop, maintain and improve object-oriented data structures, algorithms and modules in large and complex software systems.

Enhance and extend the User Interface for set-up and execution of engineering simulations.

Engages a network of expert professionals to collaborate and accomplish development objectives

Investigate defects in production code

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Degree programin Mechanical, Aerospace, Computer Science or related engineering field

Design and implementation of object-oriented application features using programming languages such as C++ or C#

Exposure to scripting languages such as Python or equivalent

Excellent written and oral communication skills

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Experience in using Microsoft Visual Studio and Software Configuration management tools (SVN, GIT)

Coursework in the area of Finite Element Analysis (FEA)

Knowledge of agile development methodologies

Experience in doing research in engineeringdiscipline like fracture mechanics, reduced order models, additive manufacturingetcor computer science domain likedistributed computing,parallel programming, artificial intelligence/machine learningetc

Knowledge of software design patterns andtest-drivendevelopment

CULTURE AND VALUES
Culture and values are incredibly important to Ansys. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs - guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Our values are crucial for fostering a culture of winning for our company:

Customer focus
Results and Accountability
Innovation
Transparency and Integrity
Mastery
Inclusiveness
Sense of urgency
Collaboration and Teamwork

WORKING AT ANSYS
At Ansys, you will find yourself among the sharpest minds and most visionary of leaders, collectively aiming to change the world with innovative technology and remarkable solutions. With the prestigious reputation in servicing well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high, met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head-on. Because at Ansys, it's about the learning, the discovery and the collaboration. It's about the "what's next" as much as the "mission accomplished". It's about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can and will impact real people in real ways, forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy and ethics.

At Ansys, you will find yourself among those eager to drive the world towards the next best thing with hands planted firmly on the wheel.
Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology so our customers can turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at lower cost. As a measure of our success in attaining these goals, Ansys has been recognized as one of the world's most innovative companies by prestigious publications such as Bloomberg Businessweek and FORTUNE magazines.

Ansys is an S&P 500 company and a component of the NASDAQ-100.

For more information, please visit us at www.ansys.com

Ansys is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Ansys does not accept unsolicited referrals for vacancies, and any unsolicited referral will become the property of Ansys. Upon hire, no fee will be owed to the agency, person, or entity.

Full Job Description
We are currently accepting applications for summer 2022 internships, and we will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis.

SIG is seeking highly motivated full-time students for our software engineering summer internship program. Our technologists build some of the most powerful trading systems in the finance industry by integrating sophisticated coding techniques with innovative engineering ideas. Our teams design and optimize systems that can process massive amounts of data while ensuring high performance and stability.

WHAT TO EXPECT:
As a software engineering intern, you’ll work alongside our experienced software engineers on the development, delivery, support and enhancements of our trading systems and infrastructure. You will have the chance to work on challenging projects that will be pushed into production. In addition, throughout the summer you’ll meet with senior technologists to learn about SIG technology and how it impacts trading.

What we're looking for

Students pursuing a BS or MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or a similar major
Strong software development skills in any object oriented language (we use C++, Python, and C# the most)
Visa sponsorship is available for this position

INTERN PERKS:
In addition to a great work experience, intern perks include:
In addition to a great work experience, intern perks include:
Housing provided for duration of internship
Relaxed dress code: jeans and sneakers are the norm and shorts all summer long
A 9,000 square-foot gym with cardio, cross fit and strength machines, plus yoga and indoor cycling classes
Social events such as a poker tournament, dinners in Philadelphia, and sporting events
Discounts for shopping, travel, dining, entertainment, and attractions
On-site services such as dry cleaning and laundry, auto repair and detailing, barber, and ATM
On-site Wellness Center staffed with full-time Nurse Practitioner

THE COMPANY:
SIG IS A GLOBAL QUANTITATIVE TRADING FIRM FOUNDED WITH A GROWTH MINDSET AND AN ANALYTICAL APPROACH TO DECISION MAKING. As one of the largest proprietary trading firms in the world, we benefit the financial markets by providing liquidity and ensuring competitive prices for buyers and sellers. We bring together the brightest minds, the best technology, and the most expansive library of data in the industry to design and implement quantitative trading strategies that make us leaders in the financial markets. Beyond trading, SIG is active in global private equity, structured capital, and institutional brokerage.

We don’t post salary ranges externally so any salary estimate you see listed on a third party website was not provided by SIG and may not be accurate.

SIG is not accepting unsolicited resumes from search firms. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at SIG via-email, the Internet or directly without a valid written search agreement will be deemed the sole property of SIG, and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by SIG.

Full Job Description
Are you motivated to participate in a dynamic, multi-tasking environment? Do you want to join a company that invests in its employees? Are you seeking a position where you can use your skills while continuing to be challenged and learn? Then we encourage you to dive deeper into this opportunity.

NeoGenomics is looking for a Service Desk Specialist Intern for our Fort Myers, FL location who wants to continue to learn in order to allow our company to grow. Working Hours: 20-30 hours per week, however flexible based on school schedule.

Now that you know what we're looking for in talent, let us tell you why you'd want to work at NeoGenomics:

As an employer, we promise to provide you with a purpose driven mission in which you have the opportunity to save lives by improving patient care through the exceptional work you perform. Together, we will become the world's leading cancer reference laboratory.

Internship Summary: This is an opportunity to develop your IT Infrastructure & Security knowledge and skills by supporting the IT Service Desk team. Primary responsibilities will be to assist the IT Service Desk team in supporting all the Company’s standards software, hardware and information security in order to provide a secure and reliable environment to all entities of the NeoGenomics infrastructure.

Responsibilities and Learning Outcomes

Interpersonal Skill Development:
Consultative Skills: Experience developing excellent relationships with internal and external customers, consultants and vendors
Communication Skills: Practice communicating technical information clearly and concisely to non-technical individuals.
Teamwork: Opportunities to partner cross-functionally to achieve Company and departmental goals.

Technical Skills:
Experience supporting a large geographically dispersed IT infrastructure.
Experience working with compliance and regulatory program requirements.
Maintaining business applications access by administering access and providing technical support
Real-Time triage experience with Level I, II, and/or Level III trouble tickets.

Preferred Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Microsoft Office Programs including Visio and MS Project
Windows Server and Desktop Products, specifically Windows 10, BitLocker, and Microsoft Active Directory
Hardware troubleshooting skills following the OSI layer model
Phone support skills and/or ticket triage skills

Required Qualifications:
Education:
Only active students will be considered
Pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field.
Experience: Academic knowledge of supporting and managing an IT infrastructure.
Ability to learn new technologies and skills quickly.
Strong time management and communication skills.
Eager to work additional hours when available when school schedule permits
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

position: Deep Learning Applied Research Intern - Fall 2021
description:
Full Job Description
NVIDIA has been transforming computer graphics, PC gaming, and accelerated computing for more than 25 years. It’s a unique legacy of innovation that’s fueled by phenomenal technology—and amazing people.

Today, we’re tapping into the unlimited potential of AI to define the next era of computing. An era in which our GPU acts as the brains of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can understand the world. Doing what’s never been done before takes vision, innovation, and the world’s best talent. As an NVIDIAN, you’ll be immersed in a diverse, supportive environment where everyone is inspired to do their best work. Come join the team and see how you can make a lasting impact on the world.

We are now looking for a Deep Learning Applied Research intern.

What you'll be doing:
Develop and prototype Computer Vision Deep Learning models for enterprise software.

Collaborate with multi-functional teams across NVIDIA to deploy your work into production.

What we need to see:
Pursuing a Bachelor's, Master's, PhD, or equivalent in Computer Science, Applied Math, Physics, or Electrical Engineering.

Very strong C/C++ programming, debugging, and software design skills.

Strong analytical problem-solving skills is a plus!

Self-managed self-starter.

Familiar with CUDA/OpenCL GPU programming.

Experience with Tensorflow or PyTorch.

Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Experience OpenGL, DirectX, or Vulkan.

Parallel Programming experience.

Experience with Numerical Methods.

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us. If you're creative, autonomous and love a challenge, we want to hear from you!

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Full Job Description
Overview:
NV5 (NASDAQ: NVEE) is a provider of engineering and consulting services to public and private sector clients, delivering solutions through six business verticals: Testing, Inspection & Consulting; Infrastructure; Utility Services; Environmental Health Sciences; Buildings & Program Management; and Geospatial Technology. With offices nationwide and abroad, NV5 helps clients plan, design, build, test, certify, and operate projects that improve the communities where we live and work.

As engineers, architects, construction/program managers, environmental professionals and beyond, we play a significant role in shaping our communities through the services we provide. We are looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team focused on Delivering Solutions and Improving Lives.

Job Summary:
The Software Developer Intern will contribute to the company by working closely with internal employees to improve, extend, and debug existing internal applications. The intern will work directly with the IT Manager to learn about the software development lifecycle, from coding to testing to deployment.

Responsibilities:
Develop and debug internal applications in C#, VB.NET, and SQL.
Provide end-user support for internal applications.

Qualifications:
Ideally a junior or senior pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Some experience with C#, VB.NET, and SQL Server.
Some experience working in Visual Studio 2019.
Exposure to AWS and Microsoft Azure a plus.

NV5 offers a competitive compensation and benefits package including medical, dental, life insurance, PTO, 401(k) and professional development/advancement opportunities.

NV5 provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, creed, citizenship status, ancestry, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. NV5 complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Full Job Description
About GreatAmerica:
GreatAmerica is a national commercial equipment finance company dedicated to helping manufacturers, vendors and dealers be more successful and keep their customers for a lifetime. While GreatAmerica has grown to more than 600 team members, our entrepreneurial spirit remains and endless opportunities lie ahead. We have experienced unparalleled year over year growth since our founding in 1992. GreatAmerica is structured in cross functional teams that allow individuals to make informed decisions that benefit the company and our customers. position: SAP iXp Intern - IT Asset Management
description:
Full Job Description
Requisition ID: 289844
Work Area: Information Technology
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:
Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

The IT Asset Management team has an opening for an intern / work student position. As part of SAP’s IT Strategic Central Services unit, the IT Asset Mgmt team offers services that enable key stakeholders in making efficient decisions in daily business & transformation via ALM Key Service Areas: Software Portfolio Mgmt, Asset Data Management & QA, Asset Compliance Mgmt. This includes driving multiple board initiatives to transform our services to a world class IT Asset Mgmt practice. This intern/ work student position will mainly be supporting scaling PMO setup which will support the IT Asset Mgmt unit & various parallel projects driving process optimization and internal transformation initiatives.

What you’ll do:
Position Title: SAP iXp Intern - IT Asset Management
Location: Newtown Square, PA
Expected Start Date: June 2021
Contract Duration: 6 months

In this role, you’ll:
As a student, you will perform routine tasks to support the effective and efficient running of the Asset Lifecycle Management (ALM) team. This will give you the opportunity to learn and experience different roles and responsibilities within the Asset Lifecycle Management (ALM) team. Additionally, this will give you the opportunity to assist in structuring and transforming a team focusing on high performance.

Support rollout of PMO deliverables to the ITAM team and drive organizational transformational initiatives.
Support maintenance of team ITAM JAM page JIRA, ITAM wiki pages
Drive the continuous improvement of new resource onboarding packages & ITAM service catalog.
Support the execution of the ITAM skills management strategy with the development of a standard training curriculum.
Become advocate for team operating principles and procedures
Support monitoring and attainment of team goals
Support bi-weekly management reports and quarterly newsletters

Who you are:
You are a currently enrolled student at a university or a university of applied sciences:

Preferred fields of study: Computer Science, Finance or related fields
Software skills: Jira, Microsoft products (especially Excel, PowerPoint) is required, MS Teams/share point is a plus
Agile skills: Knowledge and experience in scrum and agile frameworks is nice to have
Language skills: Fluent in English is required (written and verbal) and German is a plus
Soft skills: Team player in a multi-national and multi-cultural team, an ideal candidate is organized, well-structured with high degree of passion and creativity, etc.
Others: Flourish in a work environment where flexibility is essential to adapt to changing environment

Then YOU are the right candidate for this position. We are looking forward to your application and getting to know you.

We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Full Job Description
Company Overview

At Veo, we're bringing the next generation of mobility sharing to cities and universities globally through our dockless e-vehicle system. We also offer fat-tire bikes, cargo bikes and ADA-compliant bikes – making us the only shared mobility provider with this breadth of options. We design and engineer our own vehicles, hardware and software systems to provide a greener, healthier mode of transportation to make the communities we serve more sustainable and livable. Our mission is to offer the best combination of multi-modal sharing technology and seamless customer service, so users can unlock joy in their day. We are looking for exceptionally talented individuals who are ready to take on exciting challenges and their own solutions. We are headquartered in Chicago, IL, but we are hiring across the U.S. Join us!

Job Summary

Do you want to apply AI to a real product? Do you want to practice your skill sets in a production application to customers around the nation? Are you willing to build a bridge between software and hardware and apply cutting-edge techniques to serve the users? Are you excited about solving some of the most challenging problems in transportation and urban planning? If so, you might be Veo’s Computer Vision engineer Intern!

  • This role can be done as a co-op or internship. Hiring will be done a rolling basis.
Responsibilities

Research and develop prototype using deep learning algorithms with a special focus on the perception modules and object detection
Optimize our current models
Help engineering team integrate it into the production application
Troubleshoot and debug model

Qualifications and Skills

MS or Ph.D degree in Computer Science or equivalent
Solid understanding of Deep Learning, Mathematics and Statistics
Experienced in Tensorflow or equivalent
Logical thinker and effective communicator with a clean and efficient coding style
Passionate about making the world a better place to live and ride
Published papers are a strong bonus

Benefits and Perks

Competitive compensation
Opportunity to work in a fast-paced, hyper-growth technology company
Veo credits
A commitment to professional development and mentorship

Job Description:

IOSiX is a fast growing company with technology that is at the forefront of the fleet telematics industry.

We are looking for a talented Embedded Software Intern to join our team! IOSiX has a high performing and collegial work environment, where each employee has a chance to make an immediate impact.

The candidate will have the opportunity to work on a variety of embedded software projects, and should be familiar with embedded software development, preferably including:

· Embedded software development using C and C++.

· Experience with Real Time Operating Systems (RTOS).

· Drafting and executing unit test plans

· Ability to perform root cause analysis.

· Ability to read and understand circuit diagrams.

· Knowledge of electrical circuitry.

· Knowledge of in vehicle communication networks including CAN networks.

The candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and testing the software that they create. The candidate should be self-motivated and have the ability to systematically solve problems.

The candidate should be pursuing a degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Software, Information Technology, or related field.

The position is Full Time, 40 hours per week. The job is available immediately, starting as soon as possible. Join us and be a part of the future of fleet telematics!

Founded in 2005, IOSiX is an engineering firm headquartered in Saline, Michigan. A pioneer in the development of telematics in the fleet industry, IOSiX is perfectly poised at the crossroads of technology and mobility. IOSiX designs and produces automotive and heavy truck data loggers, GPS loggers and trackers, and other aftermarket and OEM vehicle systems. position: Network System Engineer Summer Intern - Bethesda, Maryland
description:
Full Job Description
Icomera US, Inc., a fast-growing technology company headquartered in Sweden, is looking for upper-division undergraduate (junior / senior) or graduate students currently studying an engineering discipline to join our growing Solutions Engagement team in Bethesda, Maryland.

Icomera is committed to students pursuing science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) by offering the opportunity to develop and advance their careers. Here, you will be rewarded with an ever-changing, quality-oriented environment that provides everyone with the chance to learn and challenge themselves every day. The intern will gain a vast array of experience in their area of study as well as have the chance to learn and work with other business areas.

About the Job:
The Role

Icomera is looking for a Network Systems Engineer intern to learn, create, and deliver comprehensive connected vehicle solutions that meet the needs of our clients. Your role will include developing well-written software applications in tasks of low to moderate complexity in collaboration with our software engineering staff. This will be an integral part of our efforts to develop and implement customer product solutions for the transportation market. You will assist with the development of products to achieve technology objectives, deployment processes, and support current / future technology trends.

Responsibilities

Support Wi-Fi designs to include electrical schema design, interface material design, including cable lengths, connectors, inter-vehicle jumpers, roof antenna positions.
Assist in configuring network switches and routers for production and performing quality checks before installation
Support quality audits of installed designs ensuring they are accurate from a system interface perspective
Ensure all supplied components are allocated part numbers that are correctly stated on the installation drawings
Should be comfortable working with Linux OS
Should be comfortable executing a variety of concurrent hardware and software assignments
Assist in setting up Engineering Lab
Assist in developing and documenting procedures and processes
Gather system requirements, building test cases against those, and preparing the documentation for each test scenario
Execute test scenarios and prepare test report
Document and report system bugs to the appropriate development teams
Perform effective problem resolution
Document deployment steps
Create the maintenance documentation (instructions for replacing faulty components)
Document the system configuration and update the internal knowledge base (Wiki)
Mark up any changes/modifications, ensuring that these changes are modified for the production installation

We believe you should have:
A passion and desire to excel in engineering and deliver technical services
Willingness to make decisions
Good communications skills
Support-focused mindset and conflict resolution experience
Able to analyze problems and recommend solutions
Ability to cope with changing environment – including adapting to meet emergency business critical events
Happy to challenge existing processes and procedures and contribute to ideas and suggestions for improvement
Resourcefulness and troubleshooting aptitude
Enthusiastic team player with a strong work ethic
Networking knowledge including Ethernet, TCP/IP, OSI model, routing and switching.
Working knowledge of routers and switches in a lab environment, course work or technical support position
Experience in scripting languages such as Pearl, Python, coding for creating test scripts

Additional experience with following is seen as a plus

Experience in working within the Wi-Fi or passenger transport industries
Experience of ITIL and ISO 27001
Knowledge of the mobile network landscape and technologies

Qualifications

Actively pursuing an undergraduate (BS) or graduate (MS) degree in Computer Engineering, Information Technology, Information Systems Management, Software Engineering, or similar field of study. This requirement may be substituted with a minimum 1 year of applied (professionally employed) software development experience
Familiarity with Linux or another Unix variant
Familiar with Virtualization platform VirtualBox or VMware
Excellent communication skills; both written and oral
Resourcefulness and troubleshooting aptitude
Enthusiastic team player with a strong work ethic
Experience working in accordance with established processes

Our Offer

An excellent team-focused working environment with huge visibility for your efforts
An opportunity to be a part of a truly innovative and fast-growing market
A chance to make your mark on the future of technology for transport
A competitive wage
An extremely flexible, fun, and varied schedule

Does this sound like an interesting challenge for you?

You will be a part of a company that is a contributor to future technology for public transportation and which is growing rapidly. You will also be a member of a team focused environment and your workday will be fun, flexible and varied. Send your application to recruitment@icomera.com

Apply today for the possibility of becoming a part of our team!
We are always looking for the best talent. Icomera is headquartered in Gothenburg, Sweden, with main offices in the United Kingdom, Germany, France, Italy, the United States, and Canada. We are happy to accept applications from anyone who already has the right to work in these countries (for example, EU citizenship).

Please send your CV and covering letter to recruitment@icomera.com.

We only engage in direct recruitment; calls or CVs received via recruitment agencies will not be accepted.

Full Job Description
As the global leader in ATM deployment and management, no one operates more ATMs in more locations than Cardtronics. Our processing network, service delivery platform, operational expertise and scale advantages are being leveraged for cost-effective expansion into new markets of opportunity through both organic growth and targeted acquisitions. Cardtronics puts a relentless focus on improving the productivity of our ATMs for the benefit of retailers, consumers and financial institutions alike.

At Cardtronics, we are Champions of Cash… because it matters. Our purpose-driven mission is to ensure cash remains accessible and viable in our markets around the globe. Cash is woven into the very fabric of society. Cash is… a good meal with friends, learning financial responsibility, giving, caring, durable, and so much more.

The Data Analytics team at Cardtronics is looking for talent to build a world class analytics organization. We are building a work class team of data analysts, business analysts & data scientists with strategic, analytical, quantitative and modelling skills to solve complex company challenges and improve the way we operate, each day every day.

SUMMARY

Highly motivated individuals will be selected for a 12-14 week (with a possibility of a performance based extension) Analyst Development Program for Cardtronics. The selected candidates will work on a well-defined project with clear goals that will require a combination of analytical, technical (programming), quantitative & strong communication skills. The focus areas will be within the Data Analytics/Business Intelligence/Data Science needs relevant for Cardtronics business growth while providing immense opportunity to learn and grow. Project definition:

Build Reports, Dashboards, Visualizations & drive change management – Training and adoption
Understand Cardtronics data structures, databases and Business to data conversion subject matter expertise to independently run data queries to create reports & explain analysis
Be an integral part of the data warehousing project and work closely with the technology teams to groom sprint stories, do UAT’s and validations
Understand user data needs and translate to build dashboards & powerful visualizations in Business Intelligence tool Logi
Drive change management activities such as Training users on dashboards to drive adoption and self-service for the users, other user forums to answer questions on data, usability and drive evolution of the dashboards
The right candidate will be self-motivated and have a “Product Maker” mindset in approaching the internship. Strong conceptual thinking to understand the business and ability to grasp analytical & technical concepts
The candidate will work directly under the supervision of a Manager with expertise in the area for supervision in defining project goals, milestones and deliverables through the duration of the 12-14 weeks.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Partnership: Work closely with colleagues from Sales, Operations, Product, Finance and others to understand their domain, processes and come with solutions for their problems and tools to make their day to day operations efficient and effective
Strategic and Analytical Orientation: Experienced in decision making and problem solving based on analytics. Conceptual thinking for framework creation combined with strong quantitative orientation to solve complex problems with rigorous analytics and monitoring
Strong Technical/Programming Skills: Orientation to & ability to code in languages such as SQL, Python, integrate structured & unstructured internal & external data sources to create user interfaces, adept at building visualizations using UI tools
Strong orientation and experience in building reporting visualizations, dashboards using tools such as Logi/Zoom, Alteryx, Arcadia, Tableau, Business Objects, Micro Strategy, Cognos or others
Strong Communication Skills: Strong written and oral communication skills coupled with skills to influence and drive agreement through intellectual, interpersonal and negotiation skills
Execution Focus: Build and manage execution plans of business intent, requirements, execute against the strategy and monitor results
Results Focus: Focused on achieving short- and long-term goals. Able to drive and execute an agenda in uncertain, fluid environment with minimal supervision
Strong business judgment, leadership and integrity: Tenacious decision maker able to bring healthy, aggressive yet responsible approach to business

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor’s degree preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, Electrical or Software Engineering, Data Science or related fields
Strong SQL and Python programming skills
Knowledge of relational databases - design, modelling, debugging, and query optimization
Hands on experience with UI tools such as Logi/Zoom, Tableau, Alteryx, Arcadia or any others
Strong new data technology orientation with new coding languages/open source databases
Proficiency in version control/SCM
Advanced skills in MS Office
Pivot tables, vlookup and complex formulae in Excel

About Cardtronics

Cardtronics plc is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. All employment decisions at Cardtronics plc are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color,religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. Minimum age of 18 or older

position: Intern - I&C Engineering - KK - LYH - May 2021
description:
Full Job Description
Looking for an exciting opportunity in the nuclear industry? Grow your career at Framatome!

Framatome is a major international player in the nuclear energy market recognized for its innovative solutions and value-added technologies for designing, building, maintaining, and advancing the global nuclear fleet. The company designs, manufactures, and installs components and fuel for nuclear power plants and offers a full range of reactor services.

With 14,000 employees worldwide, every day Framatome’s expertise helps its customers improve the safety and performance of their nuclear plants and achieve their economic and societal goals.

Join the energy conversation with Framatome Inc. on Twitter: @FramatomeUS and Facebook: @FramatomeUS.

Framatome is owned by the EDF Group (75.5%), Mitsubishi Heavy Industries (MHI – 19.5%) and Assystem (5%).

JOB DESCRIPTION

Framatome is seeking an Engineering Intern to support our I&C Electrical and Instrumentation organization.

This qualified individual will:
In a team-based environment, support Engineers who design digital and analog control systems for nuclear power plants. Working alongside more senior engineers, will assist in defining system requirements, developing system logic and defining control parameters to satisfy requirements.

You will also assist in performing system integration of hardware and software platforms, as well as prepare documentation such as requirements, test procedures, and instruction manuals. You will assist senior design engineers during installation and start-up of delivered I&C systems and with hardware design for integration with software (system integration with some board level design).

Required Skills

Required Experience

All candidates must meet the following minimum requirements in order to be considered for this opportunity.

Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer or Electrical Engineering/Engineering Technology, Computer Science or Physics, with at least four semesters completed by start of internship/co-op.
Please attach a copy of your unofficial academic transcript as part of your application. Transcripts can be added in the Profile Attachments section (Step 5) of the online application.
Strong academic performance
Strong math and computer programming coursework/experience
Strong technical problem-solving abilities
Strong interpersonal skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to use typical laboratory equipment such as Signal Generators, Oscilloscopes, DVMs, Power Supplies, and logic analyzers
Completed curriculum or labs in analog and digital electronics design (for those seeking a Hardware-oriented internship)
Lab experience involving software and hardware integration

The following requirements are desired and will be used to differentiate all candidates who apply for this position.

Previous internship/co-op experience in field of study

Lab experience in embedded system design and programming

Lab experience with 2D CAD or 3D modeling software (i.e., AutoCAD, Solidworks)

Coursework or other experience with a high level programming language such as C++, C#, Java, Visual Basic, or LabView

Skills in analog & digital electronics design

PCB layout (Eagle)

PLC programming

This opportunity is in Lynchburg, Virginia

After work you will enjoy all that Central Virginia has to offer. From beautiful Smith Mountain Lake to the scenic Blue Ridge Mountains you can hike, mountain bike, snowboard and water ski to your hearts content. You'll avoid the traffic hassles of a major city, while being in driving distance to many of the major cities, beaches and attractions along the mid-Atlantic coast. Take in a minor league baseball game or one of the many festivals in the region. Our Young Generation Nuclear group hosts numerous social and professional development events that will allow you to quickly build relationships and advance your career.

Framatome is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

Full Job Description
The Public Employment Relations Board (PERB) is seeking to hire a student assistant. The student will learn and assist with fiscal and accounting functions as well as being the primary backup for business services. This position is ideal for gaining an understanding of fiscal operations; law office experience; exposure to state government; and developing skills applicable to an entry-level career.

Conditions of Employment

This is a part-time, temporary, non-benefited, student position. Employment in all positions with University Enterprises, Inc. is dependent upon the mutual consent of University Enterprises, Inc. and the employee. This means that either University Enterprises, Inc. or the employee can, at any time, terminate the employment relationship at will, with or without cause.

Depending on the type of position you are applying for, a pre-employment background check consisting of one or more of the following may be conducted, employment history, professional references, criminal check, educational verification (i.e., degree, license, or official transcript) and physical exam and drug urinalysis test. Applicants will be required to pass required pre-employment checks to the satisfaction of University Enterprises Inc., (UEI) and the hiring Agency or Department.

Work Schedule

Flexible, Monday through Friday from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. Final schedule will be determined by supervisor.

Additional Work Schedule

Student Assistant and Graduate Assistant employees generally work up to 20 hours per work week (Sunday – Saturday) during the academic year and up to 40 hours per work week during breaks; Winter, Spring & Summer.

Student Assistants are not permitted to telecommute or work remotely.

Area Sacramento
On/Off Sacramento State Campus Off Campus
Worksite City Sacramento
Pay Range $14.00 - $15.50 per hour
Department/Agency Public Employment Relations Board (PERB)
Unit/Division Administration
Project Description

The Public Employment Relations Board (PERB or Board) is a quasi-judicial administrative agency charged with administering the eight collective bargaining statutes that govern California public sector labor management relations. To learn more visit www.perb.ca.gov.

Majors/Fields of Study Business Administration, Accounting, Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Information Systems, Civil Engineering, Computational Analysis, Computer Science and Engineering, Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Engineering, Government , Law, Public Policy and Administration
Minimum Qualifications

  • Minimum 2.95 grade point average.
  • Experience with Microsoft Office – Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
  • Ability to learn new applications/software systems effectively and efficiently.
  • Knowledge of financial analysis and reporting methodologies.
  • Knowledge of basic accounting principles, including generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP).
  • Strong organization skills with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks.
  • Ability to process requests consistently with high level of accuracy.
  • Ability to prioritize problems and promptly resolve or escalate when necessary.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work with and collaborate with peers and other staff as needed.
  • Ability to provide excellent customer service to internal staff and external constituents.
  • Strong time management skills and ability to manage individual assignments and complete duties within tight deadlines.
  • Ability to independently complete tasks with minimal supervision.
  • Requires the ability to work with and maintain confidential information.
Prerequisites

Must be a college student attending classes during the regular term (Fall, Spring and Winter, if applicable), at one of the accredited colleges or universities on our affiliation list.

To view our current affiliation list please paste the following URL into your browser: http://www.calinterns.org/wp-content/uploads/Affiliation_List.pdf

Students must be enrolled at a minimum in; six semester units or nine quarter units for undergraduate students; four semester units or six quarter units for graduate students.

Students declared major must match the major(s) listed in the job posting.

Preferred Qualifications
Duties and Responsibilities

  • Work with program and project managers to develop the organizations budget.
  • Utilize Excel and Visio to track pertinent data.
  • Review budget proposals for completeness, accuracy, and compliance with State laws, rules, and regulations.
  • Develop and apply skills in all areas of fiscal operations such as accounts payable, travel expense claims, receivables, accounting reports, budget development, budget projections and reconciliation.
  • Develop and maintain reports and logs using Excel.
  • Research and develop internal processes, forms, and reports to contribute towards operational improvement.
  • Special projects applicable to coursework and career interests.
  • Assist with business services functions as needed.
  • Perform document remediation on PERB Board Decisions for compliance with AB 434, ADA accessibility requirements.
Physical Requirements

Sit for extended periods; frequently stand and walk; manual dexterity and hand-eye coordination; corrected hearing and vision to normal range; verbal communication; use of office equipment including computer workstations, telephones, calculators, copiers, printers and scanners; use of basic tools and ability to lift/move up to 40 lbs. with or without a reasonable accommodation.

Working Conditions

PERB is located in a great mid-town location with a wide variety of restaurants and ideal for public transportation. Street and lot parking are available, but at the cost of the intern.

Work is performed in an office environment.

Hours Per Week Students (part-time) 0-20 hours per week during the academic year, up to 40 hours per week during breaks; (Winter, Spring and Summer). (NSTU)
Posting Date 05/17/2021
Closing Date 06/17/2021
Open Until Filled No
Special Instructions to Applicant

Please complete all fields of the employment application. Include your educational history in the “Educational Experience” section and any employment history in the “Employment Experience” section of our application. Must submit resume, cover letter, and unofficial transcript.

Full Job Description
Waymo is an autonomous driving technology company with a mission to make it safe and easy for people and things to get where they’re going. Since our start as the Google Self-Driving Car Project in 2009, Waymo has been focused on building the World’s Most Experienced Driver in hopes of improving the world's access to mobility while saving thousands of lives now lost to traffic crashes. Our Waymo Driver powers Waymo One, our fully autonomous ride-hailing service, as well as Waymo Via, our trucking and local delivery service. To date, Waymo has driven over 20 million miles autonomously on public roads across 25 U.S. cities and conducted over 20 billion miles of simulation testing.

Software Engineering builds the brains of Waymo's fully autonomous vehicles. Our software allows our vehicles to perceive the world around them, make the right decision for every situation, and deliver people safely to their destinations. We think deeply and solve complex technical challenges in areas like robotics, perception, decision-making and deep learning, while collaborating with hardware and systems engineers.

Waymo interns work alongside leaders in the industry on projects that deliver significant impact to the company. We believe learning is a two-way street: leveraging your knowledge while providing you with opportunities to expand your skill-set. Interns are an important part of our culture and our recruiting pipeline. Join us at Waymo for a fun and rewarding internship!

In this internship, you’ll:
Gain understanding of weather detection and estimation using test data or real-world logs
Research and implement solutions to detect and estimate weather onboard on autonomous vehicles
Exercise decision making regarding onboard sensor and architecture based on data analyses and modeling results

At a minimum we’d like you to have:
Must be enrolled in a MS/PHD program or already hold an advanced degree in computer science, robotics, electrical engineering, or similar technical field of study
Experience in at least one of: robotics, deep learning/machine learning, signal processing, estimation and modeling, and statistical analyses
Experience in data structures and advanced algorithms
Experience programming in Python

We prefer candidates to have:
Experience with audio signal processing and/or computational analyses of audio signals
Experience programming with tensorflow, or similar frameworks
Experience programming in C++
General Perks
Help solve challenging problems with a direct impact on the company
Competitive compensation packages with a housing/relocation bonus (if applicable)
Medical, dental, and vision insurance
Fun intern events and networking opportunities
Onsite Perks (These perks will only be applicable if the internship is on site)
Free breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks
Free access to Google shuttles
Onsite gym

Note: This fall internship position is planned to be located in our Ann Arbor office. However, as the situation around COVID-19 remains unclear, this position may switch to fully virtual. Your recruiter will discuss the available options during the interview process. We will accept resumes on a rolling basis until the role is filled. To be in consideration for multiple roles, you will need to apply to each one individually - please apply to the top 3 roles you are interested in.
